choices.A: They are listening to the radio.
choices.C: Lily is listening to the radio and Lucy is searching the Internet.
choices.D: Lucy is listening to the radio and Lily is searching the Internet.

questions.explanation: Lily is listening to the radio and Lucy is surfing the Internet.

choices.A: The writer is doing his homework.
choices.B: There are some red and yellow flowers in the garden.
choices.C: The uncle is good at playing basketball.
choices.D: Lucy likes popular music very much.

questions.explanation: The passage says Lily likes popular music very much, not Lucy.

question_sets.context:
It was a Saturday in May. When Mrs. Black opened the door and looked out, she smiled and said, "It's a beautiful day." She woke(叫醒)her small son up at eight thirty and said to him, " Get up, Tod. Let's go to the zoo today. Wash your hands and face, brush your teeth and eat your breakfast quickly. We are going to New York by train."
Tod was six years old. He was very happy now, because he liked going to the zoo very much, and he also liked going by train. He said, "I dreamed about(梦见) the zoo last night, Mummy."
His mother was busy, but she stopped and smiled at her little son, "And what did you do in the zoo in your dream?" Tod laughed(大笑)and answered, "You know, Mummy! You were there in my dream, too."

questions.text: What did Mrs Black say when she look out of the window? _____

choices.A: Get up, Tod. Let's go to the zoo today.
choices.C: What did you do in your dream

questions.explanation: Mrs. Black said, "It's a beautiful day" when she looked out the window, which is similar to "It's a fine day."
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Synonym Replacement

questions.text: Where did Tod live ?He lived in _____
questions.explanation: The passage indicates they are going to New York, which is in the USA.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Location Identification

questions.text: Why was Tod so happy ?Because he _____.

choices.B: He liked to go to the zoo

questions.explanation: The passage says he liked going to the zoo and going by train, so both are correct.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Cause & Effect

questions.text: Which is not true? ____

choices.A: The story happened on a April morning
choices.C: They went to the zoo by train
choices.D: Mrs Black woke up her son at night

questions.explanation: A is incorrect because it was May. B is incorrect because it takes place in the USA. D is incorrect because it was morning.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: What time did Tod get up ?____
questions.explanation: The passage says Mrs. Black woke him up at 8:30.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Time Expressions

question_sets.context:
Mr. Wu:Good morning, Bruce. Sit down, please. May I ask you some questions?
Bruce:Certainly. What do you want to know?
Mr. Wu:First, when were you born, Bruce?
Bruce:On June 22, 1990.
Mr. Wu:Secondly, where were you born?
Bruce:In Sydney, Australia.
Mr. Wu:Where was your father born?
Bruce:He was born in Sydney, too.
Mr. Wu:When was he born?
Bruce:Sorry, I don't know. But I know he's about forty years old.
Mr. Wu:I see. What does your father do?
Bruce:He's a doctor. He works in a hospital here.
Mr. Wu:Is your mother working in China, too?
Bruce:No, she works in Sydney. She's coming to China soon.
Mr. Wu:Oh, that's very good. I have no more questions. Thank you, Bruce.
Bruce:You're welcome, Mr. Wu. Good-bye.
Mr. Wu:Good-bye.

questions.text: When was Bruce Born?
questions.explanation: Bruce said he was born on June 22, 1990.

questions.text: Where was Bruce born?
questions.explanation: Bruce said he was born in Sydney, Australia.

questions.text: When was Bruce's father born?
questions.explanation: Bruce's father is about forty years old, and Bruce was born in 1990.

questions.text: What does his father do?
questions.explanation: Bruce said his father is a doctor.

questions.text: Where is Bruce's mother working now?
questions.explanation: Bruce said his mother works in Sydney.

question_sets.context:
Long long ago, there lived a poor man named Ali Baba. One day when he was cutting wood in the forest, he saw a large number of men coming towards him. He was frightened (害怕的) and climbed up into a large tree. When the men got to a big rock, they get off their horses and took off a lot of heavy bags. Ali Baba was sure that they were robbers (强盗).
A moment later, one of the robbers said to a big rock, "Open, Sesame(芝麻)!". Then a door opened in the rock. The robbers entered and the door shut again. After a long time, the door opened and the robbers came out, one of them said, "Close, Sesame!" And the door closed at once. Then the robbers got on their horses and left. Ali Baba came up the rock and said, "Open, Sesame!" The door opened. He filled several bags with gold and diamonds, and put the bags on his donkey. Then he said, " Shut, Sesame!". The door closed at once and he rode back to the town.

questions.text: What was Ali Baba doing when he saw a large number of men?

choices.A: He was sitting in front of a tree.
choices.C: He was cutting wood in the forest.
choices.D: He was sitting on a rock.

questions.explanation: He was cutting wood in the forest.

questions.text: Why did Ali Baba hid into a large tree?

choices.A: Because he was afraid of the men.
choices.B: Because he wanted to do some exercises.
choices.C: Because he wanted to cut wood.
choices.D: Because he liked climbing the trees.

questions.explanation: He was frightened (害怕的) and climbed up into a large tree.

questions.explanation: He filled several bags with gold and diamonds

questions.text: How did the robbers get the things in the cave?

choices.A: They bought them in the market.
choices.B: They robbed them from other people.
choices.C: They picked them up from the road.
choices.D: Some of their friends sent the things to them as presents.

questions.explanation: Ali Baba was sure that they were robbers.

questions.text: After coming back to the town, Ali Baba would become <blank>.
questions.explanation: He filled several bags with gold and diamonds

When it's cold, we_shiver_and need to wear warm clothes and scarfs. When it's raining, we need raining-coats or umbrellas(雨伞). When it's hot, we need a cool place and want a cold drink(饮料).

question_sets.context: Here are two pictures. A man and a boy are in one picture. Who are they? Let me tell. The man is Mr White, and the boy's name is Bill. He's the man's son. A woman was at the cinema, and she was enjoying the film very much, but there was a man in the next seat, and he began looking at the floor under her. The woman was angry and asked,             "What are you doing there? What are you looking for?"
"A piece of chocolate," the man said to her, "I dropped it on the floor."
"A piece of chocolate?" the woman said angrily, "It's dirty now! Take this and be quiet, please! I'm listening to the film!" She gave the man a big piece of chocolate.
"But," the man said, "One of my teeth is in the chocolate!"

question_sets.context:
"Which meal do we all need most, breakfast, lunch or dinner?" Miss Baker asks. Boys and girls wave their hands in the air. They know the answer.
"What do you think, Jim?" Miss Baker asks.
"Dinner," Jim answers.
"Dinner is the big meal of the day," says Miss Baker. "But I don't think we need it most."
Tom puts up his hands. "Do we need lunch most?"
"No." says Miss Baker. "We need breakfast most."
"Why is this so?"
"From night to morning is a long time to go without food," says Ann.
"That's right." says Miss Baker. "We need food every morning. What may happen to us if we have no breakfast?"
The students have many answers to give.
"We may feel hungry."
"We may not feel like working."
"We may feel sick."
"Yes, you are right." says Miss Baker. "Now let's talk about what makes a good breakfast. Give me your answers. I will write them on the blackboard."
The first word Miss Baker puts on the list is milk. What else do you think she puts on the list? Write your answers.

choices.B: Some of the boys and girls.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, the teacher and her students are discussing eating.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Miss Baker thinks dinner is a big meal of the day.

choices.B: Because there are usually a lot of nice things to eat at breakfast.
choices.C: Because people like to enjoy food before going to work.
choices.D: Because from night to morning is a long time to go without food.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, breakfast is the most important meal because from night to morning is a long time to go without food.

question_sets.context: Some small children don't know it's not polite to laugh at others. Some of them often laugh at a lame(瘸) or blind(盲的) person, or someone in bad clothes. But as they grow up(长大), they learn not to hurt people's feelings by laughing at their problems. They learn to laugh at other things. Most important, they learn to laugh at themselves(他们自己). For example, you make a mistake and lose in a basketball match. Do you become angry? Or can you laugh at yourself and hope to do better next time? If you can, you really grow big.

question_sets.context:
Do you know how to write an English letter and envelope?
When we write a letter in Chinese, we always put the date at the end of the letter. But it is different in English. We have to put it on the top of the right corner. And above the date, we also write the number of our house and the names of our street, city and country. To begin the letter, we always use words like "Dear Sir", "Dear Mr./Miss/Ms…". To end the letter, we usually use words like "Yours", "Yours ever" or "Truly yours".
Now read the following envelope, please.

But the girl says to him, "Why are you buying all these? Are you meeting friends in the cinema all the time?"
"No, I'm not doing that." the small man says, "But a big woman always stops me at the door and tears( 撕掉 ) my tickets up."

question_sets.context: Every year people celebrate the Spring Festival in China. Usually it is in January or February. It is the most important festival in China. Parents always buy new clothes for their children and children also buy presents for their parents. On the Spring Festival Eve(除夕),all the family members come back home. They sing, dance and play cards. When they enjoy the meal, they give each other the best wishes(祝愿) for the coming year. They all have a good time.

question_sets.context:
We drink tea every day. But more than 400 years ago, most people in Europe(欧洲) did not know anything about tea. Some had heard about it ,but very few knew what to do with it.
Here is a story about an English sailor(水手)who went to countries all over the world. He had been to China and India. One day he came home and brought some tea as a present for his mother. She told her friends about the present and invited them to a "tea party".When her friends came to the "tea party",the old woman gave them brown tea leaves. Her friends began to eat them of course, nobody liked the tea leaves. At that moment the sailor came in ,he looked at the table and said,"Mother, what have you done with the tea?"
"I boiled it, as you said."
"And what have you done with the water?"
"I poured it out, of course."answered the mother.
"Now you may throw away the leaves."said the sailor.

choices.A: boiled the tea and threw the leaves away
choices.B: boiled the tea and poured the water out
choices.C: knew more about tea than others

questions.explanation: The passage states the mother 'boiled it, as you said' and 'poured it out, of course'.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Inference Skills

questions.text: At the "tea party" <blank>.

choices.A: everybody enjoyed the brown tea leaves
choices.B: some of her friends enjoyed the brown tea leaves
choices.C: nobody enjoyed the brown tea leaves
choices.D: the old woman enjoyed the brown tea leaves

questions.explanation: The passage says 'Her friends began to eat them of course, nobody liked the tea leaves'.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

choices.B: the tea his mother has made was too strong
choices.C: he didn't like his mother's friends
choices.D: he himself didn't like the tea leaves

questions.explanation: The son said 'Now you may throw away the leaves' because his mother had not prepared the tea correctly.

It is the afternoon of the Mid-autumn Day. All Yangyang's friends from London are in his home. They are going to have a dinner party.
Yangyang is showing them some photos in the sitting room. His parent's Mr and Mrs Zhang are cooking in the kitchen. His sister is helping them.
Dinner begins at 6:30. All the young people are sitting at the table. Dishes are coming one after another. They all smell (闻起来) wonderful and taste delicious. Everybody enjoys the meal except (除了) Helen. She can not use her chopsticks. She tries again and again and makes the others laugh(笑). At last she has to use a spoon(勺子).
Near the end (结束) of the dinner, Yangyang's parents come and sit between Jack and May. They are happy to be with these young people.
After the dinner, Yangyang's father drives the children to the station. They are going to take the night train to Shanghai, for a short visit.

question_sets.context:
B
American people like to say "Thank you" when others help them or say something kind to them. People of many countries do so, too. It is a very good habit.
You should say "Thank you" when someong passes you the salt on the table, when someone walking ahead of you keeps the door open for you, when someone says you have done your work well, or you have bought a nice thing, or your city is very beautiful. "Thankyou" is used not only between friends, but also between parents and children, brothers and sisters.
"Excuse me" is another short sentence they use. When you hear someone say behind you, you know that someone wants to walk past you without touching you. It's not polite to break (打断)others when they are talking. If you want to speak to one of them, say"Excuse me" first, and then begin talking. You should also do so when you begin to cough or make any noise before others.
Let's learn to say "Thank you" and "Excuse me".

questions.text: 1.You should say "Thank you" when ___________

choices.A: You say something kind to others
choices.D: You need others to help you.

questions.explanation: The passage says to say "Thank you" when others help you.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that people in many countries say Thank you.

questions.text: 3.You should say "Excuse me if you want to ________
questions.explanation: The passage provides the options as reasons to use excuse me.

questions.text: 4. When you are going to ask someone to tell you the way, you should say "________"
questions.explanation: You should say "Excuse me".

questions.text: 5.This passage mainly tells us the way __________
questions.explanation: The main idea of the passage is to tell us the way to be polite.

question_sets.context:
你想知道中西方的节日有何不同吗?快来看看这两封电子邮件吧!
To:__From:__
Subject: Autumn! Date:29/09/ 8:00 p.m.
Hello, Jenny!
Today is the Mid-Autumn Festival. We will watch the moon tonight, and look for Chang'e and Wu Gang. We usually eat mooncakes. They are round, like the moon.
National Day is also in autumn, on October 1st. My mother and father are usually free for seven days! We will do many things together. I like going to the National Day celebration.
But the best thing in autumn is my birthday. It's in October. I will be fifteen years old. Goodbye.
Yours,
Li Ming
To:__From:
Subject: _______! Date:29/09/ 9:12 p.m.
Dear Li Ming,
Thank you for your e-mail! I love autumn too. In Canada, we have an autumn holiday called Thanksgiving Day. Family members always celebrate it together. I will go to my grandmother and grandfather's house. My uncles, aunts and their children will be there too.
Canadian Thanksgiving Day is in early October. In the USA, they celebrate Thanksgiving Day in late November.
Have a good time on your birthday, Li Ming! On my birthday, I have a cake with candles. Everyone sings the song "Happy birthday". Then I blow out the candles! Will you have a cake for your birthday?
Your friend,
Jenny

When it's cold, we_shiver_and need to wear warm clothes and scarfs. When it's raining, we need raining-coats or umbrellas. When it's hot, we need a cool place and want a cold drink.

question_sets.context:
There are four seasons in a year in China. Spring comes in February. May, June and July make the summer season. August, September and October make the autumn season. November, December and January make the winter season. In different seasons people wear different clothes and do different things. For example, the weather is hot, so people usually wear cool clothes and do things like swimming, boating or surfing.
Near the North Pole there are only two seasons. They are winter and summer. In winter, nights are long. For more than two months you can't see the sun, even at noon. In summer, the days are long. For more than two months the sun never goes down and there is no night.
The people living near the North Pole are called Inuit. In summer they live in tents and catch deers for food. In winter they live in small round snow houses. They can build a snow house in two hours. They travel around by using dogs to carry their things. They make holes in the ice and catch fish and seals. They eat much meat but not many vegetables.

questions.text: The two seasons near the North Pole are ________.
questions.explanation: The passage states that 'Near the North Pole there are only two seasons. They are winter and summer.'

questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'In winter, nights are long. For more than two months you can't see the sun, even at noon.'

questions.text: Autumn in China ________.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'August, September and October make the autumn season.'

questions.text: Near the North Pole ________in summer.

choices.C: there's no night for more than two months

questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'In summer, the days are long. For more than two months the sun never goes down and there is no night.'

questions.text: The people in the North Pole eat much ________.
questions.explanation: The passage states that 'They eat much meat but not many vegetables.'

question_sets.context:
Tom goes to see his grandparents with his father. On the train Tom often puts his head out of the window. His father says, "Tom, don't put your head out of the window." But Tom goes on putting his head out of the window.
His father takes Tom's hat quietly, hides it behind his back and says to Tom, "You see, your hat is gone." Tom is afraid. His father says, "Well, whistle(吹口哨)once. Maybe your hat will come back." Tom whistles. His father puts the hat on Tom's head quickly. "Oh! It's wonderful!" Tom laughs and says. He quickly takes his father's hat and throws it out of the window. "Now it's your turn to whistle, Dad!" he says happily.

question_sets.context:
All around the world, people drink tea. But tea does not mean the same thing to everyone. In different countries, people have very different ideas about drinking tea.
In China, for example, people always drink tea when they are getting together. They drink it at any time of the day at homes or in the teahouses. They prefer plain tea, with nothing else in it.
Tea is also important in Japan. The Japanese have a special(特殊)way of serving tea called tea ceremony(茶道).It is very old and full of meaning. Everything must be done in a special way in the ceremony. There is even a special room for it in Japanese homes.
Another tea-drinking country is England. In England, the late afternoon is "tea time". Almost everyone has a cup of tea then. The English usually make tea in a teapot and drink it with milk and sugar. They also eat cakes, cookies and a few sandwiches at tea time. This is the so-called "Afternoon Tea" in Britain.
In the United States, people drink tea mostly for breakfast of after meals. Americans usually use tea bags to make their tea. Tea bags are faster and easier than making tea in teapots. In summer, many Americans drink cold tea―"iced tea". Sometimes they drink canned iced tea, just as soda.

choices.D: in Japan, China and other Asian countries

questions.explanation: The passage starts with 'All around the world, people drink tea.'

questions.explanation: The passage states, 'They drink it at any time of the day at homes or in the teahouses.'

questions.explanation: The passage mentions the tea-drinking habits of China, Japan, England and America. India is not mentioned.

question_sets.context:
Mrs. Green's telephone number was three-four-six-three, and the number of the cinema near her house was three-four-six-four, so people often made a mistake and telephoned her when they wanted the cinema.
One evening the telephone rang and Mrs. Green answered it. A tired man said, "At what time does your last film begin?"
"I am sorry," said Mrs. Green, "but you have the wrong number. This is not the cinema."
"Oh, it began twenty minutes ago," said the man. "I am sorry about that. Good-bye."
Mrs. Green was very surprised, so she told her husband. He laughed and said, "The man's wife wanted to go to the cinema, but he was feeling tired, so he telephoned the cinema. His wife heard him, but she didn't hear you. Now they will stay at home this evening, and the husband will be happy!"

questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that "Mrs. Green's telephone number was three-four-six-three."

questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage states that people often made a mistake and telephoned her when they wanted the cinema.

choices.B: Because the man said sorry to her.
choices.C: Because the man didn't answer her and said the other thing.
choices.D: Because the man's voice was very low.

questions.explanation: The man asked about the film schedule even after Mrs. Green said it wasn't the cinema, meaning he didn't acknowledge her.

questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states, "Mrs. Green was very surprised".

question_sets.context:
Bill is a student. He is twelve. The child likes to fly kites and play some other games.
One Monday afternoon Bill flies kites with his friends after school. But Bill's kite is in the tree and he cannot get it. Bill and his friends do not know what to do . They worry very much and Bill comes to his father for help. His father wants to get the kite down from the tree, but he can't. So Bill asks him to make a new one for him. The man makes a new kite. When the boy gets the new kite, he is very glad. He thanks his father for the kite and goes out to play with his friends.

question_sets.context:
Everybody has a home .People have homes. Animals have homes. People live in many different kinds of houses. Animals have different kinds of homes, too.
Some animals live in holes(洞)under the ground . The woodchuck(土拨鼠) lives under the ground .His home has two doors. If any animal comes into one door, the woodchuck goes out through the other . Some animals live in holes in trees. Some squirrels(松鼠)build nests (窝) high in trees. Most of the birds live in nests in trees. But hawks(鹰)build their nests high in the mountains(山).

question_sets.context: Joan is an American girl. She lives in China now. She is in my class. Her parents work in China, too, but her brother works in the U.S.A. He often writes letters to them. Joan likes Chinese class very much, and likes speaking Chinese with us after class. Her father teaches us English well. We all like his class. On Sundays, Joan goes to the People's Park with her father and mother. Sometimes she goes shopping with her mother. They like the Chinese food very much. It's a happy family.

question_sets.context:
I am a school girl. My brother and I are twins(双胞胎). We are both at school. We like school. My parents are both teachers. They work hard. My brother and I study at No. 1 Middle School. These are twenty-five boys and eighteen girls in our class.
We go to school from Monday to Friday. We have no classes on Saturdays and Sundays. We usually get up at six, and have breakfast at 6:30. We come to school at 7:00. Classes begin at eight.
We have four lessons in the morning and two in the afternoon. We have lunch at 12:15. At three fifty we have sports.
We study Chinese, maths, English, geography (地理), physics(物理),history, politics(政治)And other lessons. We like Chinese. We like English, too. Some of us are good at it. We go home at 5:00. We have supper at 6:00. We do our homework at seven every evening and go to bed at half past nine, but sometimes we go to sleep at about ten.
We work hard, we study for the people.

questions.explanation: According to the third paragraph 'At three fifty we have sports.', so the answer is D.

This is my school. There are many trees and flowers in it. The teaching building is big and tall. There is a big playground in our school. After 4:30 in the afternoon, many students come to the playground to play football and some students play table tennis in the table tennis room.
There are 1,200 students in 25 classes in our school. The students all like to study. The teachers in our school are very good. They help the students to study and the students like them, too.

question_sets.context:
The crow is an ordinary bird. It is about twenty inches long and black all over. Crows are dirty birds because they live on old bad food. Crows eat a lot of waste food. In this way they are more useful to us than any birds. They clean up the dirty things in our streets. Crows are always hungry. They look for food all day long, and in the evening you can see them in large numbers flying back to their nests in the trees. They sleep there at night.
Crows are much noisier than other birds. Very often a large number of crows will get together on one house and talk. Sometimes they talk together, and sometimes they do it by turns like human beings. It is easy to tell from crows' sounds whether they are pleased or angry. Perhaps crows talk a lot because they are friendly birds. A pair of crows will live together all their lives, and if one of them dies, the other one becomes very sad and quiet for the rest of its life and sometimes it dies, too.

questions.text: A crow is _________ inches long.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the crow is about twenty inches long.

choices.A: They are black all over the body.
choices.B: They like to eat dirty food.

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that crows are dirty because they live on old bad food and eat a lot of waste food.

questions.text: Crows are always _________.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that crows are always hungry.

questions.text: Why are crows more useful to us than any birds?

choices.C: They are flying in large numbers.
choices.D: They eat a lot of waste food.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that crows are useful because they clean up the dirty things in our streets by eating waste food.

questions.text: You can tell from crows' sounds _________.

choices.A: whether they are hungry or full
choices.B: whether they are pleased or hungry
choices.C: whether they are ill or healthy
choices.D: whether they are living or dead.

questions.explanation: The passage says, 'It is easy to tell from crows' sounds whether they are pleased or angry.'

question_sets.context:
Most people make their living with their hands. But Tom makes his living with his feet. A very good living it is, too.
Tom's story began in a very small city in England. His parents were very poor. Seven people lived in their small house. Tom had no place to play in but in the street.
Tom's father often played football, and little Tom wanted to play football, too. So his father made a nice ball for him to play. The little boy played it every day.
At last Tom learned to play a real football, and after a few years he could play football very well.
Now Tom is one of the best football players.

He is very happy because there is going to be a nice football match on TV at four this afternoon. He wants to watch it very much. But he is going to have English and Chinese lessons. He thinks hard and finds a way. "Hello, Mrs Black," Peter says to his teacher on the telephone. "Peter is ill in bed. He wants to ask for half a day's leave(请半天假)." "Oh, I'm sorry to hear that," says Mrs Black. "But who is that?" " It's my father, Mrs Black."

question_sets.context: Tom went to see his grandparents with his father. In the train Tom often put his head out of the window. His father said, "Tom, don't put your head out of the window." But Tom went on putting his head out of the window. His father took Tom's hat quietly and hid it behind his back and said to Tom, "You see your hat is gone." Tom was afraid. His father said, "Well, whistle(吹口哨)once. Maybe your hat will come back." Tom whistled. His father put his hat on Tom's head quickly. "Oh! It's wonderful!" Tom laughed and said. He quickly took his father's hat and threw it out of the window. "Now it's your turn to whistle, Dad!" he said happily.

question_sets.context:
We often talk about the weather. If we want to know about the weather. We can turn on the radio and listen to the weather report. We can also turn on the TV and watch the Weather Show. And we can ask other people in two different ways, " What's the weather like today?"or "How is the weather today?" Sometimes you can call at 121 for the weather.
When it's cold, we_shiver_and need to wear warm clothes and scarfs. When it's raining, we need raining-coats or umbrellas. When it's hot, we need a cool place and want a cold drink.

question_sets.context: There are many people in the bus. A woman is near the window with her son. She says to the conductor(售票员), "Please give me a ticket to Beijing." She gives the conductor two yuan. But the conductor looks at the boy. He asks the boy, "How old are you?" The boy says loudly, "I'm five at home and I'm two on a bus." All the people laugh (笑). Later, the woman gives one yuan for her son's ticket.

questions.text: Are there many people on the bus?
questions.explanation: The first sentence in the passage says that there are many people on the bus.

questions.text: How old is the boy?
questions.explanation: The boy says that he is five at home.

questions.text: Where is the woman going?
questions.explanation: The woman asks for a ticket to Beijing.

questions.text: Who is the woman?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that she is with her son.

questions.text: How much money does the woman give the conductor at last(最后)?
questions.explanation: She initially gives two yuan and then gives one more yuan later.

questions.text: Which one is right?

choices.A: The woman and the boy are on a train.
choices.B: The woman doesn't want to buy a ticket for the boy.
choices.C: The conductor on the bus is not kind.

questions.explanation: The correct statement is that the woman and the boy are on a bus

question_sets.context:
Many people do not like to stay at home on holidays. They want to go out to see something different or do something exciting. So people from the country go to the city and people from the city go to the country for holidays. During the holidays, trains, buses and planes are all very busy. It is very hard to buy train tickets or air tickets. Many people take cars or buses for traveling.
Last May Day my family went to the country by car for our holiday. There was too much traffic on the road, so we had to move very slowly. It took us about an hour to get out of the town. After some time, we came to a farm. It was clean and beautiful. The animals were very cute, we thought it was a nice place for a picnic, so we stopped and took the food, fruit and drinks out of the car. We sat down under a big green tree and began to eat. Suddenly a strong wind blew and soon it started to rain. We had to run back to our car and had our picnic in the car. Then we drove back home. What a bad trip it was!

questions.text: Many people don't like to stay at home on holidays because <blank>.

choices.C: they want to see something new
choices.D: they want to see different people

questions.text: The family went to <blank> for holidays last May Day.
Last May Day the family trip was <blank>.
It's hard to buy train tickets or air tickets because <blank>.

choices.B: many people want to go by train or plane
choices.C: it's cheap to take a train or plane
choices.D: it's fun to take a train or plane

questions.text: What is the meaning of"blew"? The meaning is <blank>.

question_sets.context:
Swimming is very popular in the world. People like swimming in summer, even in the other three seasons. Because water makes people feel cool and swimming makes people keep fit①.
If you swim in a wrong place, it may not be safe. A lot of people died when they were enjoying themselves in the water, and most of them were students. Last summer, a few students from one school went to swim in the river near their school. As a result②, three of them never came out of the river.
Now some people are not careful enough in swimming. They often think they can swim so well that③nothing will happen to them in water.
Summer is here again. If you go swimming in summer, don't forget that a lot of good swimmers have died in water. They died not because they couldn't swim, but because of their carelessness④. Don't get into water when you are alone. If there is a"No Swimming"sign⑤, don't get into water. If you remember these, swimming will be safe and enjoyable⑥.
Notes:
1. keep fit 保持身体健康
2. as a result 结果
3. so…that 如此……以致
4. carelessnessn.粗心
5. signn.牌子(标志)
6. enjoyableadj.享受的,舒服的

questions.text: <blank> like swimming in summer.
People like to swim in summer because <blank>.
Some swimmers died in water because <blank>.

choices.A: they think they can swim well

questions.text: The writer wants to tell us <blank>.

choices.B: that we should go swim in summer
choices.C: that we must be careful in swimming
choices.D: students should not swim in the river

questions.text: Which of the statements (叙述) is true?

choices.A: Swimming in a wrong place may not be safe.
choices.B: No people died when they were enjoying themselves in water.
choices.C: Nothing will happen to good swimmers in winter.
choices.D: If someone goes swimming in summer, he will die.

question_sets.context:
Go and watch the baby when he is asleep , see how his chest rises and falls , then rises and falls again .
He does not know what he is doing .but he breathe as well as the oldest and cleverest man in the world . He began to breathe when he was born , and he will not stop until he dies; still  he does it without thinking about it .
See how long you can hold your breath.
In some places men dive in the sea for pearls. They pick up shells(贝壳) that hold the pearls , and the longer they stay under their breath as long as they possible can . Yet even these pearl divers can't go without breathing for a long time .
Watch to see how many times a man draws his breath every minute . Some men breathe fifteen times . It was told that a mouse breathes a hundred and twenty times each minute .
No one needs to tell us that what we breathe every minute of every day is air . It is around us everywhere , like wonderful sea that we can not see .

questions.text: 56. When a baby is asleep,

choices.B: his chest rises and falls again and again .

questions.explanation: According to the first sentence, when a baby is asleep, his chest rises and falls again and again.

questions.text: 57. Why do the divers stay as long as they can in the deep sea ?

choices.A: Because they want to hold their breath .
choices.B: Because they can stay in the deep sea for many years .
choices.C: Because they want to get more pearls .
choices.D: Because they think it is hard to breathe on land .

questions.explanation: The divers stay as long as they can in the deep sea because they want to get more pearls.

questions.text: 58. An elephant breathe 112 times_  _than a mouse every minute .
questions.explanation: A mouse breathes 120 times per minute. An elephant breathes less times than a mouse every minute

questions.text: 59. The word "It" in the last paragraph(段) means_  _.

choices.A: wonderful sea that we can not see .
choices.C: the mouse that need to breathe most .
choices.D: the elephant that doesn't need to breathe .

questions.explanation: According to the last paragraph, 'It' refers to air that is around us.

questions.text: 60. Which is the best title(标题) for this passage ?

choices.C: All the living things need to breathe .
choices.D: Divers are breathing in the sea.

questions.explanation: The passage discusses breathing in general for living things, so 'All the living things need to breathe' is the best title.

question_sets.context:
Little Peter is a boy of nine. He began to go to school the year before last and now he's in Grade Three. He lives not far from the school but he's often late for class. He likes watching TV in the evening and goes to bed late, so he can't get up on time in the morning.
This term Mrs Black, Peter's aunt, works in Peter's school. he teaches Grade Three maths. he's strict with Peter and often tells the boy to obey(遵守)the school rules and come to school on time. Yesterday morning Peter got up late. When he hurried to school, it was a quarter past eight. His aunt was waiting for him at the school gate.
"You're ten minutes late for the first class, Peter." Mrs Black said angrily. "Why are you often late for class?"
"Every time, when I get to the street corner, I always see a guidepost. It says, 'CHOOL-GO SLOW!'"

questions.text: 61. Peter is in school for ______ years.
questions.explanation: He began to go to school the year before last, so he's in school for more than two years.

questions.text: 62. Peter is often late for school because______.

choices.C: he can't sleep well at night
choices.D: he can't get up on time in the morning

questions.explanation: The passage states he goes to bed late, so he can't get up on time in the morning.

questions.text: 63. Mrs Black is a ______.
questions.explanation: Mrs. Black teaches Grade Three maths.

questions.text: 64. The first class begins at ______.
questions.explanation: Peter was ten minutes late for the first class at a quarter past eight.

questions.text: 65. The guidepost is for ______.
questions.explanation: The guidepost says 'CHOOL-GO SLOW!', which sounds like 'School, go slow!' to drivers, so the guidepost is for drivers.

She comes from the USA. We are in the same grade. But we are in different classes. We have the same Chinese teacher. His name is Zhang Yinggang. Mr Zhang is a good teacher. We all like him.

questions.explanation: The passage states, 'I learn Chinese in Beijing University.' This indicates they are currently in China.

question_sets.context:
Jim lives and works in a factory near London. He works hard from Monday to Friday. On Saturday and Sunday he doesn't go to work. Sometimes he goes to see his friends. This Saturday he is going to London with his friend, Mike. They are going to see their friends there.
They are going to take the 2:40 train on Friday afternoon. When they get to London, Jim's friend, Jack, is going to take them home in his car. They are going to stay with Jack for the night.
On Saturday morning they are going to get up early. After breakfast Jack is going to take them to Oxford University. Mike's friend, Mr. White, is a teacher there. He is going to show them around the university.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Jim works from Monday to Friday.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, on Saturday Jack is going to take them to Oxford University.

questions.text: How many people are mentioned (提及) in this passage?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions Jim, Mike, Jack and Mr. White.

question_sets.context: Most children like to watch TV. It's very interesting. By watching TV they can see a lot, learn a lot and know many things about their country and about the word. Of course they can also learn on the radio. But they can learn better and more easily (更简单) on TV. Why? Because they can hear and watch at the same time. TV helps to open children's eyes. TV helps to open their minds (智力), too. Many children watch TV on Saturday and Sunday. They always have a lot of homework to do. But some children watch TV every night. They usually go to bed late. They don't have a good rest. How about you, my young friends?

questions.text: <blank> is very interesting.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, watching TV is very interesting.

questions.text: Many children can see a lot and know many things <blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, children can learn a lot by watching TV.

questions.text: TV can help children open their<blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, TV can help children open their minds and eyes.

questions.text: Most children watch TV <blank>.
questions.explanation: Many children watch TV on Saturday and Sunday, which means weekends.

questions.text: <blank> are busy with their lessons.
questions.explanation: The passage implies that most children have homework to do, some watch TV every night.

question_sets.context: Mr.Brown is 80 years old. Every morning he goes for a walk in the park. And he comes home at twelve thirty for lunch. But today a car stops at his house. At twelve. Two policemen help him get out. One of them says to Mr.Brown's daughter, "The old man can't find his way in the park. He asks us to take him home by car." The daughter thanks the policemen and leave. Then she asks her father,"Dad, you go to that park every day. But today, you can't find the way. What's wrong with you?" The old man smiles like a child and says, "I can find my way. I don't want to walk home."

Today Mr.Brown comes home <blank>.

question_sets.context: There is a new park near Andy's home. It's fine today. Andy and his family are in the park now. On their left, there is a café. On their right, there is a big lake. There are many flowers and trees around the lake. There's a small hill behind the lake. Near the lake, there are two signs. One says, "Don't swim in the lake!" The other says, "No fishing!" But you can go boating on the lake. There is a beautiful garden in the middle of the park. There are green grass and beautiful flowers in it. There are some small shops between the lake and the garden. The park is so nice. Andy and his family like it very much.

questions.text: The park near Andy's home is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states 'There is a new park near Andy's home' and 'The park is so nice', indicating it's new and beautiful.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Identifying Adjectives; Describing Parks

questions.text: Is there a café in the park?
questions.explanation: The passage states 'On their left, there is a café'.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Finding Specific Information; Cafés in Parks

questions.text: People can <blank> on the lake.
questions.explanation: The passage states 'But you can go boating on the lake'.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Identifying Activities; Lake Activities

questions.explanation: The passage states 'There are some small shops between the lake and the garden'.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Identifying Size; Shops in Parks

questions.explanation: The passage states 'Andy and his family like it very much'.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Expressing Opinions; Family Preferences

question_sets.context: A man has a parrot. It is blue and green. It can speak like a man. Every morning the man goes to talk with it. But the parrot does not say anything to him. Then one morning the man is angry.(生气)it. He does not give it any food and water. The next morning the man goes to see the parrot again. He says something to it. But the parrot does not speak. At last the man says "Fool! You are a fool." Soon he hears(听到)the same words from the parrot. He laughs(大笑). He loves it very much. It is clever parrot.

questions.text: The parrot <blank> say anything to the man.
questions.explanation: The parrot initially doesn't want to say anything to the man, but later it speaks.

questions.text: Parrots <blank> speak like a man.
questions.explanation: The passage implies that parrots have the ability to speak like humans.

questions.text: The man wants to <blank> something with the parrot.
questions.explanation: The man wants to have a conversation with the parrot, so 'talk' is the correct choice.

questions.text: Which is right?

choices.A: The man does not want to see the parrot again.
choices.B: The parrot does not say anything.

questions.explanation: The passage says "He loves it very much.", so the man likes the parrot.

questions.text: Why does the man laugh? Because <blank>.

choices.A: he likes the parrot very much
choices.B: the parrot can speak to him
choices.C: he thinks the parrot is very clever.

questions.explanation: The man laughs because the parrot repeats his words, showing its cleverness.

question_sets.context:
A mother and her young son got on a bus and sat down. A girl, selling tickets
on the bus, came to them for their money. She was the conductor. The mother
said, "I want a full ticket." Then she gave the conductor some money.
The conductor looked at the boy and asked, "How old are you?"
The mother started to speak, but the conductor stopped her, and the boy said,
"I'm six years old at home, and four years old on buses and trains. My mother
told me that."
The mother's face turned red. She had to take some more money out of her
bag and gave it to the conductor. The conductor gave her a full ticket and a half-
price one.

questions.text: The conductor looked at the boy because ________.

choices.C: she thought the boy needed to buy a half-price ticket.

questions.explanation: The conductor wants to check if the boy needs a half-price ticket.

questions.text: Why did the conductor ask the boy?

choices.A: Because the boy's words were not right.
choices.B: Because the boy could tell the truth (真相)
choices.D: Because she liked the boy very much.

questions.explanation: The conductor wanted the boy to tell the truth about his age.

questions.text: The boy's ______ told the boy to tell a lie(撒谎)
questions.explanation: The passage says that the boy's mother told him to say that.

questions.text: At last the mother had to ________.

choices.A: buy a half-price ticket for the boy.
choices.D: give her ticket to the conductor.

questions.explanation: The mother had to pay for the correct ticket.

questions.text: Which of the following is RIGHT?

choices.A: The woman was too poor to buy the ticket.
choices.C: Every boy must buy a ticket on the bus.
choices.D: The boy was six years old.

questions.explanation: The boy said he was six years old at home.

question_sets.context:
One day Tom and Bill went out for a walk. On the road they saw a lot of
people and went up to have a look. Oh dear! There was a cow in the middle of the
road. It would not move. The cars and buses could not get past. Then a policeman
came. "Whose cow is this?" he asked."It's mine,"said a farmer,"but I can't
move it." The policeman and the farmer did their best to move the cow, but it
would not move. Tom and Bill laughed, but the drivers of cars and buses were
worried. "We can't move the cow," the farmer and the policeman said."What
shall we do?"
"Give him a cabbage!" Tom said. "That's a good idea." said the farmer.
Soon he found a cabbage and showed it to the cow. When the cow saw the
cabbage, it walked after the farmer at once. All the cars and buses could get past
at last.

questions.text: Tom went out for a walk <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence says Tom went out for a walk with Bill.

questions.text: The cow was <blank>.

choices.C: in the middle of the road
choices.D: pleased to see so many people

questions.explanation: The passage clearly states the cow was in the middle of the road.

questions.text: Tom and Bill <blank>.

choices.A: helped to move away the cow
choices.B: waited for the trucks to get past first
choices.C: were sad to see the cow was hungry
choices.D: went up and saw a cow in the middle of the road

questions.explanation: The passage indicates Tom and Bill went to see what was happening.

questions.text: <blank> thought out a good idea to move away the cow.
questions.explanation: Tom suggested giving the cow a cabbage.

questions.text: The cow wouldn't move itself because <blank>.

choices.B: it wanted to get on one of the trucks
choices.D: so many people were watching it

questions.explanation: The cow moved after seeing the cabbage, implying it was hungry.

question_sets.context:
Today is Sunday. Our class meets at seven thirty a.m. at the school gate. We take a bus to Haian Park. The price(价格)of the ticket(票) for each adult(成人) is eighteen yuan, but for each student is half. The park is open from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.
First we play games in the park. And then we have dinner at noon. After that we sit and chat under the trees. At half past three, we go to the Swimming Club. We come back home at about six o'clock in the afternoon because(因为) it is time for all of us to have supper. We are tired(累) but we are very happy.

questions.text: We meet <blank>
questions.explanation: The passage states that the class meets at the school gate.

questions.text: The price of the ticket for each student is <blank>yuan.
questions.explanation: The ticket for each student is half the adult price, which is eighteen yuan. Half of eighteen is nine.

questions.text: The park is open for <blank>hours a day.
questions.explanation: The park is open from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., which is nine hours.

questions.text: After dinner we sit and chat<blank>
questions.explanation: The passage states that after dinner, they sit and chat under the trees.

questions.text: Why do the students go home at about six p.m.?

choices.C: Because they go home for supper
choices.D: Because they have some homework to do

questions.explanation: The passage states that they come back home at about six o'clock because it is time for all of them to have supper.

question_sets.context: Peter felt (感到) very sorry because he forgot (忘记) to say "Happy Birthday" to his uncle yesterday. So he wrote a letter to his uncle : "My dear uncle, I'm very sorry because I forgot your birthday. But to teach me a lesson, you'd better (最好) forget my birthday on Tuesday, tomorrow."

question_sets.context: Mrs. Andrews had a young cat, and it was the cat's first winter. One evening it was outside when it began to snow heavily (下大雪). Mrs. Andrews looked everywhere (到处) and called its name, but she did not find it, so she called the police and said, "I lost a small black cat. Did anybody find one?" "No, Madam, " said the policeman. "But the cats are really very strong animals. They sometimes live for days in the snow, and when it melt (融化) or somebody finds them, they are all right." Mrs. Andrews felt happier when she heard this. "And," she said. "Our cat is very clever (聪明). She almost (几乎) ---" The policeman was getting tired. "Well, then, " he said, "Why don't you put your telephone down? Maybe_she_is trying to telephone you now. "

questions.text: Mrs. Andrews' cat <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Mrs. Andrews lost a small black cat.

choices.D: It ran everywhere happily in the snow

choices.B: It happened when the policeman was tired
choices.C: It happened when the snow melted

choices.D: Mrs. Andrews talked too much to him on the phone

question_sets.context: Harry liked driving (开) his car very fast, and one day he hit (撞) another car. Harry jumped out and ran to it. There was an old man in the car. He was very angry and said to Harry. "What are you doing?" "You nearly killed (撞死) me!" "Yes," Harry answered, "I'm very sorry." He took a bottle out of his car and said, "Drink some of this. Then you'll feel better." He gave the old man some whisky (威士忌), and the man drank it, but then he shouted again, "You nearly killed me!" Harry gave him the bottle again. "I feel much better now. But why aren't you drinking?" "Oh, well," said Harry, "I don't want any whisky now. I'm going to sit here to wait for the police."

questions.text: Harry <blank> drove his car very fast.
questions.explanation: The passage starts by stating that Harry liked driving his car very fast.

questions.text: One day he hit a car because <blank>.

choices.A: he wanted to kill the old man
choices.B: he drank a lot of whisky
choices.C: he drove his car too fast
choices.D: he had many bottles of whisky in his car

questions.explanation: The passage states that Harry liked driving his car very fast, which led to him hitting another car.

questions.text: The old man was very angry (生气)because <blank>.

choices.D: he drove his car too fast

questions.explanation: The old man was angry because Harry hit his car.

questions.text: After drinking the bottle of whisky, the old man <blank>.

question_sets.context: My name is Li Ping . I am _1___ student of the No.3 Middle School. Our school is very big. It _2__ about four __3___ students. I am in Grade One. There _4___ four classes in Grade One. _5__ are fifty students in my class. Twenty-seven are boys. _6_ are girls. We study Chinese English, math and _7__ subjects. We have sports ___8___ the afternoon. Our teachers ___9_ very good teachers. They love _10__ work and love their students.

questions.explanation: The word 'student' starts with a consonant sound, so the indefinite article 'a' should be used.
The subject 'Our school' is singular, so the singular verb 'has' should be used.
'Hundred' is part of a number with 'four', so it is singular.
The subject 'four classes' is plural, so the plural verb 'are' should be used.
The sentence introduces the existence of something ('fifty students'), so 'There' should be used.
50 (total) - 27 (boys) = 23 (girls).
'Other' is used as an adjective to describe 'subjects'.
The preposition 'in' is used to indicate 'in the afternoon'.
The subject 'Our teachers' is plural, so the plural verb 'are' should be used.
'Their' is a possessive adjective that modifies the noun 'work'.

question_sets.context:
Most English people have three names: a first name, a middle name and the family name. Their family name comes last. For example, my full name is Jim Allan White. White is my family name. My parents gave me both of my other names.
People don't use their middle names very often. So "John Henry Brown" is usually called(称作) "John Brown". People never use Mr., Mrs. or Miss before their first names. So you can say John Brown, or Mr. Brown, but you should never say Mr. John. They use Mr., Mrs. or Miss with the family name.
Sometimes people asks me about my name," Why do your parents call you Jim? Why do they choose(选择) that name for you?" the answer is they don't call me Jim. They call me James. James is the name of my grandfather. In England, people usually call me Jim for short. That's because(因为) it is shorter(更短) and easier than James.

question_sets.context:
When you are in England, you must be very careful in the streets because the traffic drives on the left. Before you cross a street, you must look to the right first and then the left.
If the traffic lights are red, the traffic must stop. Then the people on foot can cross the road carefully, and they don't need to walk in a hurry.
If the traffic lights are green, the traffic can go . People on foot mustn't cross.
In the morning and in the evening when people go to or come back from work, the streets are very busy. Traffic is very dangerous then. So you have to be careful to cross the streets.
When you go by bus in England, you have to be careful, too. Remember the traffic moves on the left. Have a look first, or you'll go the wrong way.
In many English cities, there are big buses with two floors. You can sit on the second floor. From there you can see the city well. It's very fuuny!

question_sets.context:
Which is better, Radio or Television?
About fifty years ago, when television first came out, people thought that radio was no longer useful. Television has both sounds (声音) and pictures. It is much more real and interesting to watch television than to listen to the radio.
However, fifty years later radio is still very popular and it will be here for a long time. One reason is that we don't need to see pictures when we listen to the music on the radio. In fact, listening with your eyes closed is the best way to listen to a piece of music. You can think yourself on a sandy beach or up high on a mountain. In other words, you can create (make) your own pictures.
Moreover, while listening to the radio, you don't have to take your eyes off your work. For example, you can listen to the radio and drive at the same time. Or you can read a book and listen to the radio. Television, on the other hand, doesn't have this advantage (优势).
A radio is much smaller than a television. You can take a radio anywhere and turn it on anytime you want. In a quiet place you can use headphones to listen to the news or music on the radio. In this way (用这种方式) you won't disturb (打扰) anybody. Moreover, a radio is much cheaper than a television. For less than $ 20 you can buy a small radio and have fun with it.

questions.text: What is the passage mainly about?
questions.explanation: The passage discusses the advantages of radio over television.

choices.A: people can make their own pictures
choices.B: people can drive while watching it
choices.C: it has both sounds and pictures
choices.D: it's the best way to listen to music

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that television has both sounds and pictures, making it more interesting.

questions.text: People use headphones in a quiet place because <blank>.

choices.A: they don't want to listen to the news
choices.B: they don't want to disturb others

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that headphones are used to avoid disturbing others.

choices.A: people can take a radio anywhere
choices.B: people can see pictures on the radio
choices.C: a radio is bigger than a television
choices.D: the radio is about 50 years old

questions.explanation: The passage says that a radio is much smaller than a television and can be taken anywhere.

question_sets.context:
Mr.Wu: Good morning, Bruce. Sit down, please. May I ask you some questions?
Bruce: Certainly. What do you want to know?
Mr.Wu: First, when were you born, Bruce?
Bruce: On June 22, 1990.
Mr.Wu: Secondly, where were you born?
Bruce: In Sydney, Australia.
Mr.Wu: Where was your father born?
Bruce: He was born in Sydney, too.
Mr.Wu: When was he born?
Bruce: Sorry, I don't know. But I know he's about forty years old.
Mr.Wu: I see. What does your father do?
Bruce: He's a doctor. He works in a hospital here.
Mr.Wu: Is your mother working in China, too?
Bruce: No, she works in Sydney. She's coming to China soon.
Mr.Wu: Oh, that's very good. I have no more questions. Thank you, Bruce.
Bruce: You're welcome, Mr.Wu. Good-bye.
Mr.Wu: Good-bye.

questions.text: When was Bruce Born?
questions.explanation: Bruce was born on June 22, 1990.

questions.text: Where was Bruce born?
questions.explanation: Bruce was born in Sydney, Australia.

questions.explanation: The conversation only says that Bruce's father is about forty years old. A is the cloest.

questions.text: What does his father do?
questions.explanation: Bruce's father is a doctor.

questions.explanation: Bruce's mother works in Sydney, Australia.

question_sets.context:
Long long ago, there lived a poor man named Ali Baba. One day when he was cutting wood in the forest, he saw a large number of men coming towards him. He was frightened (墾殿議) and climbed up into a large tree. When the men got to a big rock, they get off their horses and took off a lot of heavy bags. Ali Baba was sure that they were robbers (膿義).
A moment later, one of the robbers said to a big rock, ＾Open, Sesame��屮醍��!￣. Then a door opened in the rock. The robbers entered and the door shut again. After a long time, the door opened and the robbers came out, one of them said, ＾Close, Sesame!￣ And the door closed at once. Then the robbers got on their horses and left. Ali Baba came up the rock and said, ＾Open, Sesame!￣ The door opened. He filled several bags with gold and diamonds, and put the bags on his donkey. Then he said, ＾ Shut, Sesame!￣. The door closed at once and he rode back to the town.

questions.text: What was Ali Baba doing when he saw a large number of men?

choices.A: He was sitting in front of a tree.
choices.C: He was cutting wood in the forest.
choices.D: He was sitting on a rock.

questions.explanation: Ali Baba was cutting wood in the forest.

choices.A: Because he was afraid of the men.
choices.B: Because he wanted to do some exercises.
choices.C: Because he wanted to cut wood.
choices.D: Because he liked climbing the trees.

questions.explanation: Ali Baba was frightened of the men.

questions.explanation: The men took off a lot of heavy bags. Ali Baba filled several bags with gold and diamonds.

choices.A: They bought them in the market.
choices.B: They robbed them from other people.
choices.C: They picked them up from the road.
choices.D: Some of their friends sent the things to them as presents.

questions.explanation: Ali Baba was sure that they were robbers.

questions.explanation: Ali Baba filled several bags with gold and diamonds.

question_sets.context:
It is five o'clock in the evening when Sally comes home from the office. She walks into the living room and looks at her three children. The children are fourteen, thirteen and nine years old. They are watching TV.
The living room is dirty and untidy. There are empty glasses and dirty clothes on the floor. There are cakes on the sofa. Games and toys are everywhere.
Sally is unhappy. "How dirty and untidy this place is!" She tells her children, "I can't work all day and then do housework all evening. I'm not going to do housework!"
And so, Sally doesn't do housework. She doesn't clean. She doesn't do the dishes. She doesn't wash clothes. Every evening she sits on the sofa and watches TV.
After two weeks, every dish in the house is dirty. All the children's clothes are dirty, too. Every garbage can(垃圾桶) is full. The house dirty and untidy.
Then, one day Sally comes home from work and gets a big surprise. The kitchen(厨房) is clean. The children cleaned the kitchen!
The next day, the living room is clean, and the children are washing their clothes.
Sally tells her children, "OK, I'll do housework again. But you have to help me."
Now Sally and her three children do the housework together. Then they all sit on the sofa and watch TV!

questions.text: Sally has <blank> children.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Sally looks at her 'three children'.

questions.text: She is <blank> to see the dirty and untidy room.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that 'Sally is unhappy' when she sees the state of the living room.

questions.text: One day, Sally gets a big surprise after she comes home. The children <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Sally gets a big surprise because 'The kitchen is clean. The children cleaned the kitchen!'

questions.text: From the story, we know the right order (顺序) of the pictures is <blank>

choices.A: d f a b c e
choices.B: f a b c e d
choices.C: c d a b e f

question_sets.context:
There was an old pear tree in a man's garden. In the past, the tree fruited every year, so the man would get many pears. But now, the tree got old. There were no more pears for the man. So the ungrateful (忘恩负义的) man decided to cut the tree down. When he walked to the tree with an axe (斧子) in his hand, the tree said to him, "Please don't cut me down. I have brought so many pears for you in the past years. Now I only have a short time to live."
"I'm sorry. I have to do so," the man said, "because I need something to make a chair." Then he began to wave his axe. At that moment, a bird in the old tree said to him, "Don't cut it down! Every time you go out and your wife feels lonely, she will come out to the garden and sit under the tree to enjoy its cool shade (树荫), and I sing songs to make her happy. We give much pleasure to your wife when you are away from home."
The man didn't listen to the bird and drove it away. When he was about to cut the tree, some bees flew out of it and said, "Listen! If you agree not to kill this tree, we will give you delicious honey every day. Would you please leave the tree with us?"
The man got moved (感动). He said, "You are so kind to the tree, although it has become old. Now I see that I shouldn't cut it down. It has done so much to me and my wife. Let the tree stay here, and let the bird continue to sing songs here." With these words, the man left.
And the old tree lived there to its last day.

questions.text: Which can be the best title (标题) of the story?
questions.explanation: The story primarily revolves around the old tree and its fate, making it the most fitting title.

questions.text: Which is the most important reason for the man to cut down the tree?

choices.B: The man needed wood to make a chair.
choices.C: The tree didn't give any shade.
choices.D: The man couldn't get any pears from it.

questions.explanation: While the man also needed wood for a chair, the initial reason he decided to cut down the tree was because it no longer produced pears.

questions.text: What made his wife happy when the man was not at home?
questions.explanation: The bird sings and the tree provides shade.

questions.text: In the story, the word"continue" means <blank>.
questions.explanation: The word "continue" means to keep going or doing something.

questions.text: What can we learn from the story?

choices.B: Good wood comes from pear trees.
choices.C: Old people are kind and friendly.
choices.D: Birds and bees are always helpful.

questions.explanation: The story teaches the importance of gratitude and appreciating what one has, as the man initially intended to cut down the tree due to its lack of pears.

Mrs Brown was eighty, but she had a small car, and she always drove to the shop in it on Saturday and bought some food for herself .She did not drive fast ,because she was old. She drove well, and never hit anything. Sometimes her grandchildren said to her, " Please don't drive your car, grandmother .We can take you to the shops."
But she always said, "No, I like driving. I began to drive fifty years ago, and I'm going to shop now. "
Last Saturday she stopped her car at some traffic lights because they were red ,and a policeman came to her and said "Good morning".But because she was very tired, she didn't realize that the policeman was her old friend. Later the policeman told us about it.

Mr Green and Mr Brown work in the same office. One day Mr Green says to Mr Brown, "I will have a small party in our house on Monday evening. Would you and your wife like to come?"
Mr Brown says, "Thank you very much. I'd love to, but let me ask my wife first." So Mr Brown goes to the other room and telephone his wife. Then he comes back and looks very worried. "What's the mater?" asks Mr Green. "Is your wife there at home?"
"No," answers Mr Brown."She isn't there. My four-year-old son answers the telephone. I say to him, 'Is your mother there, David?' and he answers 'No. she isn't in the house .' 'Where is she?'I ask. 'She is somewhere outside.''What's she doing?''She is looking for me .'"

It's Sunday. It's fine. Tom does not go to school today. But he is not home. He is now on a Chinese bus. He is going to the cinema(电影院). All his classmates(同班同学) will go to see a film(电影) this afternoon. His teacher Mr Wang will go there, too. They will meet at 2:oo p.m.at the gate(大门) of the cinema.
An old man gets on the bus. Tom stands up and says to the old man. "Come and sit here, please." The old man goes over and sits down. He says.''Thank you very much, young boy. You are a good student." Tom answers: Thank you."
"Which school are you in?" the old man asks Tom.
"I am in No.2 Middle School." Tom answers.
"No.2? That is a good school. My son is a teacher there. He teaches English." The old man says.
"English teacher? Excuse me, grandpa, What's your son's name. please?" Ask Tom
"Mr Wang," says the old man.
"Ah, ah, he is my English teacher." Just then, the bus stops near the cinema. Tom says goodbye to the old man and gets off the bus. The old man and all other people in the bus smile(微笑) to Tom.

question_sets.context:
Many teenagers feel that the most important people in their lives are their friends. They believe that their family members, and even their parents, don't know them as well as their friends do. In large families, it is quite often for brothers and sisters to fight with each other and then they can only go to their friends for advice.
It is very important for teenagers to have one good friend or a group of friends. Even when they are not with their friends, they usually spend a lot of time talking among themselves on the phone. This communication is very important in children's growing up, because friends can discuss something difficult to say to their family members.
However, parents often try to choose their children's friends for them. Some parents may even stop their children from meeting their good friends. Have you ever thought of the following questions?
Who choose your friends?
Do you choose your friends or your friends choose you?
Have you got a good friend your parents don't like?
Your answers are welcome.

choices.C: to have a discussion with their family by phone
choices.D: to talk with their friends on the phone.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that teenagers spend time talking to their friends on the phone, even when they are not with them.

choices.A: Some parents may even not allow their children to meet their good friends.
choices.B: Some parents may even ask their children to stay away from their good friends.
choices.C: Some parents may even not let their children meet their good friends.
choices.D: Some parents may want their children to stop to meet their good friends.

questions.explanation: Options A, B, and C are similar in meaning to the given sentence, while option D suggests the parents want the children to stop an action to meet their friends.

choices.C: Parents should try their best to understand their children better.
choices.D: Teenagers can only go to their friends for help.

questions.explanation: The phrase "your answers are welcome" means that the author is open to hearing or reading the reader's responses.

question_sets.context:
It was a beautiful spring morning. There wasn't rain in the sky, and the sun was warm but not too hot. So Mr Black was surprised (惊奇的 ) when he saw an old man at the bus stop with a big strong black umbrella (雨伞) in his hand.
Mr Black said to him, "Are we going to have rain today, do you think?"
"No," said the old man, "I don't think so."
"Then are you carrying the umbrella to keep the sun off you?"
"No, the sun is not very hot in spring."
Mr Black looked at the big umbrella again, and the old man said, "I am an old man, and my legs are not very strong, so I really need a walking-stick (拐杖). But when I carry a walking-stick, people say, 'Look at the poor old man', and I don't like that. When I carry an umbrella in fine weather, people only say, "Look at that stupid (愚蠢的) man'."

Bev could not do her work. She felt too tired. She put down her book, yawned (打哈欠) and felt better. Bev looked up. Had the teacher seen her? To her surprise, the teacher was yawned, too. He took a long breath (呼吸) and opened his mouth wide. He closed his eyes a bit and let out his breath in a big, slow yawn. Then Bev heard other yawns.
The teacher said, "Bev yawned because our doors and windows are closed. And the room is warm. Her body needed more air. Maybe she yawned because she was tired. Maybe she was hungry. Or she just needed to move a bit. Do you feel better now, Bev?" he asked.
"Yes, " said Bev.
"Yawns wake us up," the teacher said, "When you yawn you stretch (伸展) many parts of your body. that stretching makes you feel good." There were more yawns. "People do not know why they yawn," the teacher said. "But if you see a yawn, hear one, or even read about one, you may yawn too. And once your yawn starts, you can't stop it. You may close your mouth to stop it. But the yawn will still come."
The teacher stood up and said, "Let's open the window and let some air in. You may also go out for a drink. A cold drink or water on your face help to stop yawns. Bev may go first."
How do you feel now after you have read this story? Did you yawn? Watch a friend read this. See if your friend starts to yawn. If you see a yawn, you will know why!

questions.explanation: The passage states Bev yawned because she felt too tired. The teacher also mentioned she might be tired or hungry.

questions.explanation: The teacher said that Bev might have yawned because she was tired, hungry, or needed more air.

An Apple's Words
I am an apple. You can find me growing in many places in the world. I am like my cousins, pear and banana. I am more round than a pear, and bananas are longer than I. I am delicious, so people all over the world like to eat me. I cost very little money and I help make people healthy. There is a_saying_in English:_An apple a day keeps the doctor away_. Don't you think I'm great?

questions.explanation: The saying "An apple a day keeps the doctor away" means that eating an apple every day can keep you healthy.

question_sets.context:
Canadians like to say "Thank you" when others help them or say something kind to them. People of many other countries do so, too. It's a very good habit.
You should say "Thank you" when someone passes you the salt on the table, or opens the door for you, or says you have done your work well.
"Thank you" is used not only between friends but also between parents and children, brothers and sisters, husbands and wives.
"Excuse me" is another useful short expression. When you hear someone say so behind you, you know somebody wants to walk past without touching you.
It's not polite to interrupt(打断) others when they are talking. If you want to speak to one of them, say "Excuse me" first, and then begin talking. You should also do so when you want to make any noise before others.

choices.C: you pass the salt to others on the table

questions.explanation: You should say "Thank you" when someone opens the door for you.

questions.explanation: If you want to walk past somebody without touching him, you'd better say "Excuse me"first.

questions.explanation: When you hear others say you write very well, you should say "Thank you".

choices.B: We don't say "Excuse me" by day.

questions.explanation: "Thank you" is used not only between friends but also between parents and children, brothers and sisters, husbands and wives.

question_sets.context: Dogs are friends of man. They work for us. They hunt with us. They also play with us. But a long time ago, all over the world, dogs were wild. Dogs can go back to the Stone Age. All dogs had the same ancestor (祖先). It is believed that this ancestor was much like a wolf. Other animals, like fox, also came from this ancestor. Thousands of years ago, man began to tame (使驯服) the wild dogs. When the dogs were tamed, they were trained (训练) well. The strong dogs then became working animals. They were trained to pull heavy loads (担子). They learned to keep watching over sheep and other animals. Working dogs could do other things, too. Some dogs were not strong. But they could help man hunt. Other dogs were best at pets. At first, there were only a few kinds of dogs. Today, there are more than 100 kinds.

questions.explanation: "Wild" means 野生的, so the answer should be B.

questions.explanation: "Go back" means 追溯到, so the answer should be A.

choices.B: all dogs are as wild as they were many years ago

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that man began to tame the wild dogs, so man helped change animals. Therefore, the answer is C.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that the trained dogs were trained to pull heavy loads and learned to keep watching over sheep and other animals. Some dogs could help man hunt. Therefore, the answer is D.

questions.explanation: The passage starts by saying dogs are friends of man and describes their long history. Therefore, the answer is C.

Sick men and women were sitting on their chairs in the doctor's waiting room. They all looked sad except Tom. He was playing with some cards. Just then the doctor came to say he was ready for the next one. Tom jumped up and entered the doctor's room in a hurry.
Before Tom could say a word, the doctor made him lie down on the bed. "Now let me listen to your heart." Tom tired to speak, but the doctor told him not to say anything. "I'll take your temperature." Tom tried to sit up, but the doctor stopped him. After a while, the doctor said, "Well, you don't have a fever (发烧), boy. In fact, there's nothing wrong with you." "I'm quite well, doctor." Tom said. "I just came here to get some medicine for my grandma.

question_sets.context:
Welcome to White Pines Forest. This is one of the most beautiful places in the state. But it can also be dangerous. If you're planning a hike:
1. Wear comfortable shoes or boots, and take along an extra (额外的) pair of socks. That way you'll have dry socks to change into if you need them.
2. Wear clothing in layers(多层) that you can put on and take off. As you walk, you'll probably get warmer. Then you can just take off a layer or two. Don't forget to carry a waterproof (防水的) jacket. The weather can change quickly here.
3. Take some lightweight food along. Dried fruits, nuts, and crackers are good energy snacks. Be sure to carry plenty of drinking water. There are no water supplies(供应) along the trails.
4. There are some poisonous(有毒的) snakes in the forest, but you won't meet them if you stick to the trails. Remember, the snakes won't bother you if you don't disturb them.5. Allow yourself enough time to get back to the campground(营地) before dark. So that you won't get lost, make some marks along the way you go.Happy hiking.

questions.text: Which would be the best title for this passage?
questions.explanation: The passage gives advice and suggestions for people who are planning to go hiking, so "Tips for Hikers" is the most appropriate title.
