choices.A: They can use the socks as shoes if the weather turns cold.
choices.B: They can always have dry socks to change into.
choices.C: They can use the socks for carrying food.
choices.D: They might get bitten by a snake.

questions.explanation: The first point in the passage explains that hikers should take along an extra pair of socks so they can change into dry socks if needed.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE according to the passage?

choices.A: There are some snakes in the forest but they are not poisonous.
choices.B: You can find clear water along the trail.
choices.C: There is no danger in this beautiful forest.
choices.D: The weather changes quickly in the forest.

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that the weather can change quickly in the forest, which is why hikers should carry a waterproof jacket.

questions.text: What do you think "trail" might mean in this passage?
questions.explanation: "Trail" in this context refers to a path or track in the forest.

questions.text: The person who wrote these things mainly wants hikers to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage focuses on safety and preparation for hiking, suggesting the writer wants hikers to be cautious and careful.

question_sets.context: Many high school students in the United States take part in school activities such as sports, bands, math clubs, science clubs, and theater activities. But after-school activities are not just for high school students. Many elementary schools also have after-school programs for students.Most of the students in elementary after-school programs cannot go home when school ends because both parents work. These students are too young to stay at home alone. So the main purpose (目的) of these programs is just to look after the children until their parents can take them home. And the best part is that many of the activities in elementary schools are free for parents, unlike some daycare centers that are usually very expensive.The teachers in charge of(负责) the programs want the children to learn while they are there. So the programs may have a special time for children to do their homework. And many schools also keep the school libraries open for students. Students can go to the libraries to read books or to use the libraries' computers. But after-school programs are not "all work". There is also plenty of time for children to play in the school's playground.

question_sets.context:
One Sunday morning the whites go to the park . They get home very late . Father
opens the front door and they all go into the house . It is very dark , so mother turns
on the light . On the way to their bedroom , mother says , "Listen , John ! I can hear
someone in the bedroom ." They all stand quietly outside the bedroom door . They
can hear the voice (声音) in the room .
"You're right ," father says . "There are two men in it . They are talking ." Then
he shouts , "Who is there ?" But no one answers . Father opens the door quickly and
turns on the light . The room is empty (空的) . Then father finds something and
laughs. The radio is on ! "I forgot (忘记) to turn it off this morning ," father says .

questions.explanation: They get home very late, so they get home in the evening.

choices.B: they are afraid to go into the bedroom
choices.C: they are listening to the music
choices.D: they hear someone talking in the bedroom

questions.explanation: They hear someone talking in the bedroom, so they stand quietly outside the bedroom.

choices.A: there was no one in the bedroom
choices.B: the men in the room can't hear

questions.explanation: The room is empty, so there was no one in the bedroom.

questions.explanation: They forgot to turn it off this morning, so the radio works a day.

questions.explanation: They find the voice comes from the radio.

question_sets.context:
Many people like to watch TV. Watching TV is one of the most important
(重要的) activities of the day . TV brings the outside closer to people's homes . Some people say the world (世界) is smaller than before because of TV .
What's going in in the other countries ? How do people live in places fat away ? Is there a good sports gams somewhere ? What's life in the deepest (最深) part of the sea (大海) ?
If you want to answer these questions , just turn on the TV. Turn it on and watch . You can see a lot and learn a lot . Of course , people can also learn through reading or listening to the radio . But with TV , we can learn better and more easily . Why ? Because they can hear and watch , too . TV helps to open our eyes . TV also helps to open our minds(思想) . TV often gives us new ideas . We learn newer and better ways of doing something .

questions.text: Some people say the world is smaller than before because ______ .

choices.A: TV makes the earth (地球) smaller and smaller
choices.B: all people like to watch TV
choices.C: TV brings the outside world closer to people

question_sets.context:

But they can't see anything over the radio.
TV helps to open Children's eyes. TV helps to open their minds (智力), too. They learn newer and better ways of doing things. They may find the world is now smaller than before.
Many children watch TV only on Saturday or Sunday evening. They are always busy with their lessons. But a few children watch TV every night. They go to bed very late. They can't have a good rest. How about you, and your friend?

question_sets.context:
Clever Businessman
There is a village (村庄), and in this village everybody is rich (富有). They all have beautiful houses and nice clothes. They are good at business. One day a young man comes to the village. He talks with a businessman. "Look," he says, "You're all good businessmen. what is the secret?" "The secret is this" replies (回答) the businessman. "we eat a lot of fish, and the fish is good for our brains (头脑). It makes us clever." I see." says the young man. "And what is the name of the fish?" "I don't know." says the businessman "But if you give me ten pounds (英磅) I can send you some ." The young man thinks it's a good idea. So he gives the businessman ten pounds and tells him his address. Soon the young man receives a box. In the box, there are small fish.
After about a month (月), the young man meets the businessman again. "Thank you for sending me the fish," he says, "But listen, ten pounds is very expensive (贵) for just three small fish"."Ah, you see!" says the businessman "The fish is beginning to have an effect (效果). You are becoming (变得) clever!"

questions.text: People in the village are good at <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that they are good at business.

questions.text: The businessman tells the young man that they <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that they eat a lot of fish.

questions.text: The young man gives ten pounds to the businessman because <blank>.

choices.B: he wants to know the name of the fish
choices.C: he wants to eat the fish and become clever

questions.explanation: The young man believes that eating the fish will make him clever.

questions.text: The story tells <blank>.

choices.C: fish can really make one clever

questions.explanation: The businessman tricked the young man.

question_sets.context:
Allan taught maths in a middle school in the city. He worked very hard and really looked forward to his holidays.
He usually went to the seaside, but one year he saw an advertisement in a newspaper. "Enjoy country life, spend a few weeks at Willow Farm. I'll enjoy horse riding, walking and fishing. They'll make a change from sitting by the seaside." Four days later he returned home.
"What's wrong with Willow Farm?" his friend asked him. "Didn't you enjoy country life?"
"Country life was fine," Allan said. "But there was another problem."
"Oh, what?"
"Well, on the first day a sheep died, and we had roast lamb for dinner."
"Fresh meat is the best."
"I know. But on the second day a cow died, and we had roast beef for dinner."
"Lucky you!"
"You don't understand," Allan said. "On the third day a pig died and we had roast pork for dinner."
"A different roast every day."
"Let me finish," Allan said. "On the fourth day the farmer died and I didn't dare to stay there for dinner."

questions.text: Allan decided to go to Willow Farm because _____

choices.A: He thought it would make a change from sitting by the seaside
choices.B: He wanted to see his friend there
choices.C: The farmer at Willow Farm wanted to see him
choices.D: He wanted to enjoy the fresh air there

questions.explanation: Allan decided to go to Willow Farm because He thought it would make a change from sitting by the seaside.

questions.text: Allan stayed at Willow Farm for ______
questions.explanation: Allan stayed at Willow Farm for four days

questions.text: Allan returned so soon because ______.

choices.A: the farmer died and he had nothing for dinner
choices.B: the prices there were too high
choices.C: he always had to have the thing that had just died for dinner
choices.D: the air there was not fresh

questions.explanation: Allan returned so soon because he always had to have the thing that had just died for dinner

When Sam comes home from work in the evening, the fish is not there and his wife says, "Oh, your cat eats it. "And then she gives him some bread for his supper. Sam is angry(生气). He takes the cat and his wife to a shop near his house and weighs(称)the cat. Then he turns to his wife and says, "My fish weighs one kilo. The cat weighs one kilo, too. My cat is here, you see, then, where is my fish? "

Dear Elizabeth,
Thank you for your last letter. China is great. I like my school very much. I have lot's of friends here. They are very nice. We have seven classes every day .Four in the morning and three in the afternoon. We have English, Chinese and math every day . Four science classes a week. We go to school five days a week. I can speak a little Chinese now . I like music because the Chinese folk music is very beautiful. I like it very much. After class I play sports . I like to play volleyball, tennis , and ping-pong. I go out on Sundays . My Chinese friends tell me to go to their homes for dinner. I like Chinese food very much. Please write to me soon.
Love ,
Jane

question_sets.context:
Many people do not like to stay at home on holidays. They want to go out to see something different or do something exciting. So people from the country go to the city and people from the city go to the country for holidays. During the holidays, trains, buses and planes are all very busy. It is very hard to buy train tickets or air tickets. Many people take cars or buses for traveling.��
Last May Day my family went to the country by car for our holiday. There was too much traffic on the road, so we had to move very slowly. It took us about an hour to get out of the town. After some time, we came to a farm. It was clean and beautiful. The animals were very cute, we thought it was a nice place for a picnic, so we stopped and took the food, fruit and drinks out of the car.
We sat down under a big green tree and began to eat. Suddenly a strong wind blew and soon it started to rain. We had to run back to our car and had our picnic in the car. Then we drove back home. What a bad trip it was!��

question_sets.context:
Swimming is very popular in the world. People like swimming in summer, even in the other three seasons. Because water makes people feel cool and swimming makes people keep fit①.��
If you swim in a wrong place, it may not be safe. A lot of people died when they were enjoying themselves in the water, and most of them were students. Last summer, a few students from one school went to swim in the river near their school. As a result②, three of them never came out of the river.
Now some people are not careful enough in swimming. They often think they can swim so well that③nothing will happen to them in water.
Summer is here again. If you go swimming in summer, don't forget that a lot of good swimmers have died in water. They died not because they couldn't swim, but because of their carelessness④. Don't get into water when you are alone. If there is a"No Swimming"sign⑤, don't get into water. If you remember these, swimming will be safe and enjoyable⑥.
Notes:
1. keep fit 保持身体健康�ァ� 2. as a result 结果�ァ� 3. so…that 如此……以致��
4. carelessnessn.粗心�ァ �5. signn.牌子(标志) 6. enjoyableadj.享受的,舒服的��

question_sets.context:
In some countries, some people do not like the number 13. They don't think 13 is a lucky number. For example, they don't like to live on the 13th floor.��
One day Jack asks some friends to dinner. When all of his friends arrive, he asks them to sit around the dinner table. He begins to count the people while they are having the lovely food. Suddenly he cried out,"Oh, there are thirteen people here!"
Everyone's face turns white except(除了)Mr. Brown. He says slowly with a smile on his face,"Don't worry, dear friends! We have fourteen people here. My wife will have a baby in a few weeks."��
All of them become happy again."Congratulations(祝贺你)!"they say to Mr. and Mrs. Brown.
Then they enjoy the nice food and have a good time that evening.��

questions.explanation: Mr. Brown explains his wife is pregnant, making the total 14, relieving the superstition.

Yao Ming joined the Houston Rockets in November, 2002. He said this was a new start in his basketball life. He would do his best to learn from the NBA and improve himself. Sport analyst(分析家) Bill Walton said, "Yao Ming has the potential(潜力), the capability of changing the future of basketball."

question_sets.context:
One day, Mr. Smith went to a dinner party. He was wearing very old clothes. He came into the room. But people in the room didn't look at him. They didn't ask him to sit at the table. He wasn't happy. But he said nothing.��
Mr. Smith went home quickly and put on (穿上) his best clothes. He went back to the party. Everyone in the room stood up and looked at him. They gave him good food to eat.��
Mr. Smith took off his coat, and put it on the food and said, "Eat, coat!"��
The other people were surprised and asked, "What are you doing? Why do you do that?"
Mr. Smith answered, "I am asking my coat to eat food. When I wore old clothes, you didn't look at me. You didn't ask me to sit down. Now I am wearing these nice clothes. And you give me good food. Now I see, you give the food to my coat, not to me."��

question_sets.context:
A crow(乌鸦)is sitting in a big tree. She has a big piece of meat in her mouth."My babies will have a nice breakfast,"she thinks. An old fox(狐狸)is looking for his breakfast. He sees the crow and the meat."How can I get that piece of meat?"he thinks.
"Good morning, Mrs. Crow."says the fox,"How are you?"But the crow doesn't say a word. "You have very nice babies, Mrs. Crow."says the fox,"How are they? May I see them ?"Still the crow doesn't say a word.
"You are very beautiful, Mrs. Crow, and you have a beautiful voice(嗓子),too."says the fox,"Would you please sing a song for me? "Mrs. Crow thinks"How nice Mr. Fox is! I must sing him a song."So she opens her mouth and begins to sing. At that time, the meat drops down(掉下)from her mouth.

question_sets.context:
Mr. Day was a teacher at a school in a big city in the north of England. He usually went to France or Cuba for a few weeks during his summer holidays and he spoke French quite well. 
But last year Mr. Day said to one of his friends,"I'm going to have a holiday in Japan, but I can't speak Japanese. So I am going to go to evening classes and have Japanese lessons for a month before I go."
He studied very hard for a month, and then his holidays began and he went to Japan. 
When he came back a few weeks later, his friend asked him,"Did you have any trouble with your Japanese when you were in Japan, Dick?"
"No, I didn't have any trouble with it,"answered Mr. Day,"But the Japanese did!"

choices.D: Mr. Day didn't have much trouble with his Japanse.

question_sets.context:
Skin-diving (潜水) is a new sport today. This sport takes you into a wonderful new world. It is like a visit to the moon. When you are under water,it is easy for you to climb big rocks (岩石),because you are no longer (不再) heavy.
Here, under water, everything is blue and green. In the day, there is much light. When fish swims nearby (附近), you can catch them with your hands.
When you have tanks (罐) of air on your back, you can stay in deep (深的) water for a long time. But you must be careful when you dive in deep water. 
To catch fish is one of the most (最) interesting parts of this sport. Besides (除……之外),there are more uses for skin-diving. You can clean ship without taking them out of water. You can get many things from the deep sea.
Now you see that skin-diving is both useful and interesting.

question_sets.context:
When you are reading something in English , you may often_come across_a new word .What's the best way to know it ?
You need an English-Chinese dictionary (字典).It will tell you a lot about the word , for example (例如) , how to read this word ,what it means in Chinese and how to use this word. But there are so many English words in the dictionary and how can you know where the word is ?There is a way to look for it .
In the dictionary you can first see the words beginning with the letter A, then B,C,D,E…That means, if there are two words ,"desk" and "hour' ,"desk " will be before "hour ';"story " before" Sunday ", "tomato" before " tomorrow" etc.
The English-Chinese dictionary will be your good friend . I hope you will often use it in your English learning.

questions.explanation: The passage suggests using an English-Chinese dictionary when you don't know a word.

He takes the dog to meetings and he takes the dog to lunch. When there is telephone call for my boss, I always know if he is in the office. I only look under his desk. If I see something brown and hairy (毛绒绒的) under it, I know my boss is somewhere in the office. If there is no dog , I know my boss is out.

question_sets.context: During the day we work and play; at night we sleep. Our bodies rest while we sleep. In the morning we are ready to work and play again. While we are asleep our bodies grow most. Children who are tired usually need more sleep. We can get our lessons better and we feel better too, when we have had plenty of rest. Boys and girls who are eight or nine years old need ten hours of sleep every night. Our bodies need plenty of air when we sleep. If we do not get enough fresh(新鲜的)air we'll feel tired when we wake up. While in bed we must not cover our heads. If we do, our lungs(肺)will not get enough fresh air. If we open our windows at night we can have plenty of fresh air. Cool air is better then warm air. Boys and girls who want to grow and be strong must get plenty of sleep.

question_sets.context:
VIII.阅读理解.
I have a good boy friend. We call him Mike. He lives in Canada. He speaks English. He is the same age as I. We are both 13 years old. He often goes to the English Corner. He likes it a lot. He has a small family. His parents are both workers. They work in the same office. They all want to come to China. They all like Chinese food.
根据短文内容选择正确答案.

questions.explanation: The passage says 'We are both 13 years old'.

questions.text: What do Mike's parents do?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'His parents are both workers. They work in the same office'.

questions.text: What language does Mike speak?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'He speaks English'.

questions.text: How do Mike's parents like China?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'They all want to come to China. They all like Chinese food'.

question_sets.context:
We are learning English, but how can we learn English well? A student can know a lot about English, but maybe he can not speak English.
If you want to know how to swim, you must get into the river. And if you want to be a football player, you must play football. So , you see, you can learn English only by using it. You listen to your teacher carefully in class. You must read your lessons every day. You must speak English to your English teacher and classmates and also you must write in English. Then one day, you may find your English very good.

question_sets.context:
In England people can experience(经历) four seasons in one day. So they often talk about the weather. In the morning the weather is warm like in spring. After an hour black clouds come and then it rains hard. The weather gets a little cold. In the afternoon it will be sunny, the sun will begin to shine and it will be summer at this time of day.
In England, people can also have summer in winter, or have winter in summer, so in winter they can swim sometimes, and in summer sometimes they need to wear warm clothes.
When you go to England, you will see that some English people usually take an umbrella(雨伞) or a raincoat with them on the sunny morning, but you should not laugh at(嘲笑) them. If you don't take an umbrella or a raincoat, you will regret(后悔) later in the day.

question_sets.context:
We drink tea every day. But more than 400 years ago, most people in Europe(欧洲) did not know anything about tea. Some had heard about it ,but very few knew what to do with it.
Here is a story about an English sailor(水手)who went to countries all over the world. He had been to China and India. One day he came home and brought some tea as a present for his mother. She told her friends about the present and invited them to a "tea party".When her friends came to the "tea party",the old woman gave them brown tea leaves. Her friends began to eat them of course, nobody liked the tea leaves. At that moment the sailor came in ,he looked at the table and said,"Mother, what have you done with the tea?"
"I boiled it, as you said."
"And what have you done with the water?"
"I poured it out, of course."answered the mother.
"Now you may throw away the leaves."said the sailor.

questions.text: The mother <blank>.

choices.A: boiled the tea and threw the leaves away
choices.B: boiled the tea and poured the water out
choices.C: knew more about tea than others

questions.explanation: The passage states that the mother boiled the tea and then poured out the water, not the leaves.

questions.text: At the "tea party"<blank>.

choices.A: everybody enjoyed the brown tea leaves
choices.B: some of her friends enjoyed the brown tea leaves
choices.C: nobody enjoyed the brown tea leaves
choices.D: the old woman enjoyed the brown tea leaves

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that nobody liked the tea leaves at the tea party.

questions.text: The son asked his mother to throw away the leaves, because<blank>.

choices.A: his mother had treated (招待)her friends with the wrong thing
choices.B: the tea his mother has made was too strong
choices.C: he didn't like his mother's friends
choices.D: he himself didn't like the tea leaves

questions.explanation: The son asked his mother to throw away the leaves because she had prepared the tea incorrectly, serving the leaves instead of the water.

questions.text: Where does the sailor come from?.
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that the sailor is English.

questions.text: He had been to.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that the sailor had been to China and India.

question_sets.context:
Li Ping: Let's play football after school tomorrow.
Chen Lin: All right. I'll tell the other boys. But don't forget to bring the ball.
Li Ping: Why do you say that?
Chen Lin: I say it because you always forget to bring it.
Li Ping: No, I never forget to bring it.
Chen Lin:Yes, you do. Maybe you don't always forget, but you sometimes forget. You forgot last week. Don't you remember?
Li Ping: Well, I won't forget tomorrow.

questions.text: Who will play football tomorrow?

choices.B: Chen Lin and the other boys.
choices.C: Li Ping and the other boys.
choices.D: Li Ping, Chen Lin and the other boys.

questions.explanation: Chen Lin says he will tell the other boys, and Li Ping will also play.

questions.explanation: Li Ping suggests to play football 'after school'.

question_sets.context:
Mr. Black had two cats. One was very big and the other was quite small. He liked them very much. One day, Mr. Green, a friend of his, came to see him. He saw two holes(洞) in the door, a large hole and a small hole. He said , "My dear friend, why are there two holes in your door?" "Let the cats in and out ," answered Mr. Black.
"But why are two holes? Isn't one hole enough(足够的)?" asked his friend.
"How can the big cat go through the small hole?" he said.

questions.text: One day Mr. Green went to Mr. Black's house <blank>.

choices.C: to have a look at the cats

questions.explanation: The passage says 'Mr. Green, a friend of his, came to see him'.

questions.text: Which cat did Mr. Black like?

choices.C: The big one and the small one.

questions.explanation: The passage says 'He liked them very much'.

questions.text: How many holes in the door did Mr. Green see?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'He saw two holes in the door'.

questions.text: Mr. Green said one hole was enough because he thought <blank>.

choices.A: the small cat could only go through the small hole
choices.B: the big cat could only go through the big hole
choices.C: the two cats could go through the big hole
choices.D: the two cats could go through the small hole

questions.explanation: Mr. Green didn't understood why Mr. Black had to make two holes, and the implied meaning is that Mr. Green thought both cats could go through one of the holes.

questions.text: What kind of man would you say Mr. Black was?
questions.explanation: The situation indicates Mr. Black's lack of cleverness.

question_sets.context:
Mr Jones and Mr Brown works in the same office. One day, Mr Jones says to Mr Brow, "We want to have a small party at our house tomorrow evening. Welcome you and your wife to the party."
Mr Brown says, "Thank you very much. I must phone my wife and ask her." So Mr Brown goes to the other room and makes a telephone call. When he comes back, he isn't happy.
"Why are you not happy?" asks Mr Jones. "Do you speak to your wife?"
"No, she isn't at home. My small son answers the phone. He says she is looking for him outside( 在外面 )."

questions.text: When does Mr Jones have a party? ____________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. According to the passage, Mr Jones has a party tomorrow evening.

questions.text: Who does Mr Jones want to invite(邀请)? __________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. According to the passage, Mr Jones wants to invite Mrs Brown.

questions.text: Mr brown wants to go to the party, he goes _________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is C. According to the passage, Mr Brown goes to telephone.

questions.text: The telephone is ________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. According to the passage, the telephone is in the other room.

questions.text: Who does Mr Brown speak to? _________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. According to the passage, Mr Brown speaks to his son.

question_sets.context:
Many people like to watch TV. It is one of important activities of a day. TV brings the outside world closer to people's homes. Some people say the world is now smaller than before because of TV. Perhaps they are right.
What's going on in other countries?
What's the life like in the deepest parts of the sea? Well, Just turn on the TV. Turn it on and watch. You can see a lot and you can learn a lot. Of course, people can also learn through reading or listening to the radio. But with TV they learn better and more easily. Why? Because they can hear and watch, too.
TV helps to open our eyes. TV also helps to open our minds. TV often gives us new ideas. We learn newer and better ways of doing things.

questions.text: People do some important things in the day, but one of the most important things is to <blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, watching TV is one of the most important activities of a day.

questions.text: It is not possible to see the life of fish in the deepest parts of the sea, is it?
questions.explanation: The passage says you can learn about the life in the deepest parts of the sea by turning on the TV.

questions.text: With TV people can learn things <blank> than only listening to the radio.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, with TV people can learn better and more easily than only listening to the radio.

questions.text: In the sentence "TV brings the outside world closer to people's homes." , the word "closer" means "<blank>".
questions.explanation: "Closer" means "nearer".

questions.text: Which of the following is not true?

choices.A: Many people's favourite thing is to watch TV.
choices.B: Today's world itself is becoming smaller and smaller.
choices.C: Our minds can be helped to open by TV.
choices.D: We often get new ideas from watching TV.

questions.explanation: The passage says the world is now smaller than before because of TV, not that the world itself is becoming smaller and smaller.

question_sets.context:
It's Sunday. There are many people in the bus. And an old man is looking here and there. He wants to find an empty seat(座位). Then he finds one. He goes to it. A small bag is on the seat. And a young man is sitting beside it.
"Is this seat empty?" asks the old man.
"No, it's for a woman. She goes to buy some bananas." Says the young man.
"Well," says the old man, "Let me sit here please. When she comes back, I will(将) leave here."
The bus starts(启动).
"She doesn't come, but her bag is here. Let me give her the bag." Then the old man throws the bag out of the bus window.
The young man jumps up and shouts, "Don't throw! It's my bag!"

questions.text: The old man wants to find an empty seat <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage says that there are many people in the bus, so we can infer that the man is in the bus.

questions.explanation: The passage states that 'A small bag is on the seat'.

questions.text: The young man says the seat is for <blank>.
questions.explanation: The young man says 'No, it's for a woman'.

questions.text: The bus starts. The old man <blank>.

choices.A: asks the woman to sit on the seat
choices.B: takes the bag to the woman
choices.C: throws the bag to the young man
choices.D: throws the bag out of the window

questions.explanation: The passage states that 'Then the old man throws the bag out of the bus window'.

questions.text: The bag is <blank>. The young man doesn't want the old man to throw it away.
questions.explanation: The young man jumps up and shouts, 'Don't throw! It's my bag!'.

question_sets.context: Four friends live in a small town. Their names are Cook, Miller, Smith, and Carter. They have different jobs. One is a policeman, one is a carpenter, one is a farmer, one is a doctor. One day Cook's sonbroke his right leg, and Cook took him to the doctor. The doctor's sister is Smith's wife. The farmer isn't married(结婚). He has a lot of good hens. Miller always buys eggs from the farmer. The policeman sees Smith every day for they are neighbours.

questions.text: Who is farmer?
questions.explanation: Based on the context, since Cook is taking his son to the doctor, Smith is the doctor's sister's wife, and Miller buys eggs from the farmer, by elimination, Carter must be the farmer.

questions.text: Cook's son is taken to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The question is a typo. It should be 'the doctor'. Since Smith is the doctor's sister's wife, Miller buys eggs from the farmer, by elimination, Cook took his son to the doctor. The doctor is A.

questions.explanation: Smith is the carpenter.

questions.text: Smith's neighbour is <blank>.

questions.explanation: Cook is the policeman.

question_sets.context:
It is in autumn(秋天). A young man comes to a forest(森林). He's walking beside the forest. On his right is a river. On his left is the forest. Suddenly(突然)he sees two green eyes looking at him from the trees. A tiger(老虎)is getting ready(准备)to jump on him.
What does he do? He must jump into the river. But in the river there is a big crocodile(鳄鱼). Its mouth(嘴)is very big. The young man closes his eyes. The tiger jumps over him. And the young man opens his eyes. The tiger is now in the mouth of the crocodile.

questions.explanation: It is in autumn.

questions.explanation: He's walking beside the forest.

questions.explanation: A tiger is getting ready to jump on him.

questions.explanation: The young man closes his eyes.

questions.text: What does the man see at last(最后)?<blank>.

choices.A: The tiger is in the mouth of the crocodile
choices.B: The crocodile is in the mouth of the tiger
choices.C: A fish in the mouth of the crocodile
choices.D: A ship is in the mouth of the crocodile

questions.explanation: The tiger is now in the mouth of the crocodile.

question_sets.context:
There are twelve months in a year.
The names of the twelve months are January, February, March, April, may, June, July, August, September, October, November, December. Each month has thirty days or thirty-one days. In a leap-year (闰年), February has twenty-nine days. A leap year comes once in four years.
There are 365 days in a year.
There are seven days in a week. They are Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.
The parts of the day are morning, afternoon, evening and night.
April, June, September and November have thirty days.
All the rest have thirty-one days, except February alone.

questions.text: Which month has twenty-nine days?
questions.explanation: February in each leap year has 29 days

questions.text: Is Monday the first day of the week?
questions.explanation: Sunday is the first day of the week

questions.text: What day comes after Thursday ?
questions.explanation: Friday comes after Thursday.

questions.text: How many days are there in a year?
The parts of day are <blank>.
questions.explanation: The parts of day are morning, afternoon, evening and night.

question_sets.context:
Once there lived a lion in the big mountain．He was very big and strong．He often ate the other animals．Every day he went out to look for food．The small animals in the mountain were all afraid of him．Near the mountain there were four bulls(公牛)．They are friends, and they often worked and played together．The tiger tried(尝试) many times to catch(捕捉)them, but he could not do so．Every time he came near, the four bulls stood together to fight(战斗力) him．So he could do nothing to them．
One day, the four bulls had a quarrel(争吵)．After that each of them went his own way．When the lion saw this, he was happy．He caught one bull and ate him up(吃光)．Then he caught another．One by one (一个接一个地)he caught all the four bulls and them up．

questions.explanation: The story is about four bulls and a lion.

choices.B: Because every time he came near, the four bulls stood together to fight him.
choices.C: Because it was not very hungry.
choices.D: Because he didn't like to eat them.

questions.explanation: Every time the lion came near, the four bulls stood together to fight him.

choices.B: they wanted to find their children
choices.D: they wanted to live in other places(地方).

questions.explanation: The four bulls had a quarrel.

question_sets.context:
A little boy came to a new town with his parents. His name was Peter. His family was very rich(富有). They had a driver(司机) and they had a cook, and a lot of servants(仆人).
Peter was going to a new school. On the first day his mother said to him, "Peter, be modest at your new school. Don't say we are rich." And Peter said, "Yes, Mommy." So Peter went to school. The first class was composition(作文). The subject of the composition was My Family.
"My name is Peter. My family is very poor(贫穷). Both my father and my mother are very poor. Our driver is very poor and the cook is poor, the other servants are poor…"

questions.text: Guess! What's "be modest" in Chinese?

There is a small lake in the park. We can see some boats on the water. Some children are sitting in the boats with their parents. Listen! A girl is playing the guitar and singing. question_sets.context: Wang Ying is a good driver. She is 21 years old. She drives a car in a school. She works from Sunday to Friday. Her home isn't near the school. She gets up early at six. She goes to work at 6:30. At 7:30 she must get to school. She usually has breakfast in the school. She usually has lunch there, too. She leaves the school at 5:00 in the afternoon. She usually gets home at 5:00. And then she cooks supper and does housework. In the evening she usually watch TV at home. She likes watching TV a lot. And she also likes reading very much. She usually goes to bed at about 11:00.

questions.text: What does Wang Ying do?
questions.explanation: The first sentence says 'Wang Ying is a good driver'.

questions.text: Where does Miss Wang work?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'She drives a car in a school'.

questions.text: How old is Miss Wang?
questions.explanation: The second sentence says 'She is 21 years old'.

questions.text: Where does Miss Wang usually have supper?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'And then she cooks supper and does housework', implying she has supper at home.

questions.text: What are Miss Wang's hobbies (业余爱好)?

choices.B: Listening to music and playing the computer.

questions.explanation: The passage says 'She likes watching TV a lot. And she also likes reading very much'.

question_sets.context:
Mary wanted to buy a birthday present for her mother. But she didn't have any money. She was very sad. She thought and thought. She had an idea. She could make a present by herself①. So she used a piece of paper to make a card. On the front, she drew a beautiful picture of birds and flowers, on the back she wrote,"To my dearest mummy in the world. Happy Birthday!"
On her mother's birthday, Mary gave her the card. After she saw the card, tears②fell down③her face."Why are you crying?"Mary asked,"You don't like it, right?""Of course not,"she said, "I love it very much. I'm the happiest mother in the world. I have a great daughter like you."
Notes:
1. by herself 她自己��
2. tearn.眼泪
3. fall down 流下,落下��

questions.text: Mary <blank>.

choices.C: never did nice things for other people
choices.D: wanted to buy something for her mother

questions.explanation: From the first sentence, we can know that Mary wanted to buy something for her mother.

questions.text: What did she do with the piece of paper? <blank>
questions.explanation: She made a card using a piece of paper.

questions.text: What present does Mary give her mother? <blank>
questions.explanation: Mary gives the card to her mother.

questions.text: What did her mother think about the card?
questions.explanation: Her mother said she loved it very much.

questions.text: Which of the following sentences is true?

choices.A: Mary's mother only liked expensive presents.

questions.explanation: Her mother said she's the happiest mother in the world.

question_sets.context:
Jakie was nine years old. One day,his friend Amy said to him,"I'm going to have a birthday party on Sunday, Jakie. Can you come?"
Jakie asked his mother, and his mother said,"Yes, you can go."On Sunday afternoon, his mother said to him again"Now, Jackie, when you go to the party, remember this, you must be polite (有礼貌的), don't ask for food until(直到)someone gives it to you."
"All right, Mum,"Jakie answered, and he went to Amy's house on his bike.
There were many children at the party. They played together for an hour and then Amy's mother gave them some food; but she forgot Jakie and didn't give him any. He waited politely for a long time, and then, he took up his plate and said loudly (大声地),"Does anyone want a nice clean plate?"

questions.text: How old is Amy?
questions.explanation: The text says Jakie is nine, but doesn't say Amy's age.

questions.text: When is the birthday party?
questions.explanation: Amy said the party is on Sunday.

questions.text: Whose birthday is it?
questions.explanation: Amy said she's going to have a birthday party.

questions.text: Did Jakie go to Amy's home?
questions.explanation: Jakie went to Amy's house on his bike.

questions.text: Why did he take up his plate?

choices.A: He wanted others to look at his clean plate.
choices.B: He had a nice clean plate.

questions.explanation: He said that because he wanted some food.

question_sets.context:
From Tuesday to Friday Mr White goes to night school. He wants to learn English. It's Wednesday morning. Mr White is going to the bus stop. Now he's waiting for the bus.
The bus is coming. Mr White gets on the bus. He stands next to two old women. The men in front of them are sitting. Two men get up and give the women their seats. The old women take the seats and say, "Thank you very much. It's very nice of you."

questions.explanation: The passage states Mr. White stands next to two old women, and the men in front of them are sitting, implying the women were initially standing.

choices.D: Mr White and two old women

questions.explanation: The passage states two men give the women their seats.

question_sets.context:
It's Sunday. It's fine. Tom does not go to school today. But he is not at home. He's now sitting(坐) on a Chinese bus. He is going to the movie house. All his classmates(同学) will go to see a movie this afternoon. His teacher Mr Wang will go there, too. They will meet at 2:00 p.m. at the gate(门口) of the movie house.
An old man gets on(上车) the bus. Tom stands up and says(说) to the old man, "Come and sit here, please." The old man goes over and sits down. He says, "Thank you very much, my boy. You are a good student." Tom answers, "You're welcome."
"What school are you in?" the old man asks Tom.
"I am in No. 2 Middle School." Tom answers.
"No. 2? That's a good school. My son is a teacher there. He is an English teacher." The old man says.
"English teacher? Excuse me, grandpa. What's your son's name, please?" Tom asks.
"Mr Wang," says the old man.
"Ah, ah, he is my English teacher." Just then, the bus stops near the movie house. Tom says goodbye to the old man and gets off(下车) the bus. The old man smiles(微笑) to Tom.

questions.text: In the sentence(句子) "the bus stops near the movie house". "stop" means (意思是) <blank>.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. Stop means 停(stop).

questions.text: Which(哪一句) is right?

choices.C: Tom goes to school on Sunday.
choices.D: Tom is a student of No. 2 Middle School.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. The passage states that Tom is in No.2 Middle School.

questions.text: Mr Wang is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is B. The old man mentions that Mr. Wang is his son.

questions.text: What do you think of Tom?

choices.B: Tom is a bad(坏的) student.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is A.  Tom offers his seat to the old man.

questions.text: Which is right?

choices.A: Tom goes to the movie house on an English car.
choices.B: Only Tom and his teacher go to the movie house to see a movie.
choices.C: They go to the movie house for a meeting(会议).
choices.D: The old man's son is Tom's English teacher.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is D. The passage states that the old man's son, Mr. Wang, is Tom's English teacher.

question_sets.context:
Most people make their living with their hands. But Tom makes his living with his feet. A very good living it is, too.
Tom's story began in a very small city in England. His parents were very poor. Seven people lived in their small house. Tom had no place to play in but in the street.
Tom's father often played football, and little Tom wanted to play football, too. So his father made a nice ball for him to play. The little boy played it every day.
At last Tom learned to play a real football, and after a few years he could play football very well.
Now Tom is one of the best football players.

questions.text: Tom made his living with his ______.
questions.explanation: The first sentence states that Tom makes his living with his feet.

questions.explanation: The second paragraph states that Tom's story began in a very small city in England.

questions.explanation: The third paragraph states that Tom's father made a nice ball for him to play.

questions.text: A few years later, Tom was _____ at playing football.
questions.explanation: The fourth paragraph states that after a few years he could play football very well.

questions.text: Tom plays football _____ than many other players.
questions.explanation: The last paragraph states that Tom is one of the best football players, implying that he plays better than many other players.

Mr.Smith lives in a village(村庄), but he works in a big city. He goes to work by train every morning and comes home in the same way.

question_sets.context:
Many people like to watch TV. Watching TV is one of the most important activities of the day. TV brings the outside closer to people's homes. Some people say the world is smaller than before because of TV.
What's going on the other countries? How do people live in places far away? Is there a good sports game somewhere?
If you want to answer these and many other questions, just turn on the TV and watch it. You can see a lot and learn a lot. Of course, people can also learn through(通过) reading or listening to the radio. With TV, however, they can learn better and more easily. Why? Because they can hear and watch.
TV helps us a lot. TV often gives us new ideas. We learn newer and better ways of doing things.

question_sets.context:
Jenny and Henry were on the same day and they look the same. Their father has a taxi and he is busy all the time. He goes out early in the morning but comes back when his children go to bed. He gets a lot of money but he has no time to concern them with their studies.
The two children study in the same class. Jenny works hard at her lessons, but her brother likes nothing but playing. He is not good at writing compositions.
One day Mrs Cook told her class to write a composition "My Mother". After supper Jenny wrote one in her exercise book and then went to help her mother do some housework. But Henry went to play football. When night fell, he came back to watch TV until a TV play was over. And he took off his clothes and went to bed. He remembered the composition and had to go to the sitting room again. But he didn't know how to write it. He thought hard and at last he found a way. He found Jenny's schoolbag and brought out her exercise-book and copied her composition.
Two days later, Mrs Cook asked Henry, "Can you tell me why yours is the same composition as Jenny's?"
"Yes, I can, Madam," answered Henry. "We have the same mother."

questions.explanation: "Concern" means to care about.

question_sets.context:
Fouls ham House is a fine, large house of the 1790s. It stands by the River Byer, in Twenty-five hectares(公顷)of the best farmland in the southwest.
The house was built by Smithson , and the story goes back to George, the son of King of Whales, who fell in love with the beautiful Lady Kitty, at one of the first Fouls ham's wild woods parties. Many years ago many great men rode on the hills about Fouls ham House, and many fine girls took tea in the Green Room.
The house has eight bedrooms, three bathrooms, two living-rooms, and a dining-room with a real Adam fireplace. Its library has a good view over the park and the river. All rooms are light and airy, with good, high windows, and wood floors.
At the back of the house there is room for four cars. The third Fouls ham once kept there. In many other ways, this house of the 1790s meets the needs of the 1990s. If you wish to know more about Fouls ham House, write to:
Harvey. Platt, Long Ford & Son 6, Castle Green, Gilham, Byreside.

Some students live far from the school. About half of the students usually come to school by like. They often get to school at a Quarter to seven. About fourteen students come to school by bus. They get to school very early, too. The others come to school on foot. Their home is near the school, but they are often late class.

questions.text: <blank> students live near the school.
questions.explanation: 48 (total students) - 24 (by bike) - 14 (by bus) = 10 (on foot).

questions.text: There is <blank> students the term.
questions.explanation: The passage states that Jin Ming is a "new comer".

questions.text: There are <blank> girls in our class.
questions.explanation: 48 (total students) - 26 (boys) = 22 (girls).

questions.text: Some students come to school by bike at <blank>.
questions.explanation: "A Quarter to seven" means 6:45.

questions.text: <blank> of the students come to school on time.
questions.explanation: The passage states 'They get to school very early, too' and 'the others come to school on foot', but they are often late for class.

question_sets.context:
Flies(苍蝇) usually live in the rubbish(垃圾). Let's look at a fly, and see where it flies. First, it flies out of the windows, second, it stands on some dirty(脏)things in the street: and third, it flies back to the house and walks on your food.
When a fly walks on the dirty things in the street, its feet have got some germs(细菌)from them. When the fly walks on your food with its dirty feet, it leaves(留下)the germs on your food.
Form the we can learn, first, we mustn't leave dirty things in the street or on the ground near our house; second, all food must be covered(盖住),or flies may make all food dirty; third, flies often carry germs and we must kill(杀死)then as soon as we see them.

questions.text: Flies like <blank>.

choices.A: to live in a clean house

questions.explanation: The first sentence states that flies usually live in the rubbish.

questions.text: The germs on the fly's feet come from <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "When a fly walks on the dirty things in the street, its feet have got some germs(细菌)from them."

questions.text: The first thing, we must <blank>.

choices.A: leave dirty things in the street
choices.C: leave dirty things on the ground near our house.

questions.explanation: The passage says, "we mustn't leave dirty things in the street or on the ground near our house".

questions.text: Next, we lean that we must <blank>.

choices.A: put our food on the table

questions.explanation: The passage says, "all food must be covered(盖住),or flies may make all food dirty".

questions.text: We also learn that flies are no good and <blank>.

choices.A: we must get rid of them
choices.C: we must keep them in the house
choices.D: we must keep them in some food

questions.explanation: The passage says, "we must kill(杀死)then as soon as we see them."

question_sets.context:
You're welcome, ladies and gentlemen. Everything in our restaurant is cheap and delicious. Let's have a look. For breakfast, you can eat porridge, eggs and noodles. For lunch and dinner, you can have rice, dumplings, different kinds of meat and vegetables. There are also some drinks for you. Come and have a meal, please. It's a good place to enjoy yourself.
Breakfast: porridge($1.00), egg($1.00), noodles($2.50－$5.00).
Lunch and dinner: rice ($1.00), dumplings ($5.00), cabbage ($6.00), carrots ($8.00), potatoes($8.00), chicken ($12.00), fish ($15.00), mutton ($18.00);green tea ($2.00), iced tea ($3.00), orange juice ($4.00).
Business hours: Mon.－Fri. 6:30 a.m.－9.30 p.m. ; Sat.－Sun. 7:00 a.m.－10.00 p.m..

questions.text: What can you eat for breakfast in the restaurant_________.
questions.explanation: You can eat noodles for breakfast according to the passage. B is correct.

questions.text: You can have a meal in the restaurant________.
questions.explanation: According to the business hours, the restaurant opens at 7:00 on Saturday morning. For Mon-Fri, it opens at 6:30 a.m. and closes at 9:30 p.m. So B is wrong. For Sat. - Sun, it opens at 7:00 a.m. and closes at 10:00 p.m.. You can have a meal in the restaurant at 11:30 every morning.

questions.text: If you have rice, cabbage, and green tea for lunch, you need to pay___________.
questions.explanation: rice ($1.00), cabbage ($6.00), green tea ($2.00). So you need to pay $9. B is correct.

questions.text: Mr Black goes to the restaurant with $ 22 for dinner. He can order rice, potatoes, chicken and _________.
questions.explanation: rice ($1.00), potatoes($8.00), chicken ($12.00), and iced tea ($3.00). The total is $24, which exceeds $22.  rice ($1.00), potatoes($8.00), chicken ($12.00), and orange juice ($4.00). The total is $25, which exceeds $22. rice ($1.00), potatoes($8.00), chicken ($12.00), and green tea ($2.00). The total is $23, which exceeds $22. rice ($1.00), potatoes($8.00), chicken ($12.00). Mr. Black needs to have an egg ($1.00) for breakfast.

questions.text: What does the speaker probably(可能) do ?
questions.explanation: The speaker probably introduces the food in the restaurant. C is correct.

question_sets.context: One Sunday afternoon Mr Green and his child, Mary, are in a big shop. Mr Green likes Mary and wants to buy a new dress for her. Mary doesn't like the new dress. She likes something to eat. So her father buys two kilos of apples for her, too. Mary also wants to buy some picture-books and colored pencils. There are many things and many people in the shop. They are men and women, old and young. They all want to buy something there. The people in the shop are very friendly.

questions.explanation: The first sentence states 'One Sunday afternoon'.
